column2: Cauliflower, potato, garam masala, turmeric, curry leaves
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.

Step 2:
Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 chopped green chili. Sauté for 1 minute.

Step 3:
Add 2 chopped tomatoes and cook until soft. Add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.

Step 4:
Add fried potatoes and cauliflower florets. Mix well and cover the lid. Cook for 10-12 mins on low flame until soft.

Step 5:
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Add lemon juice if desired.

column2: Potato, peas, chillies, ginger, garam masala, garlic
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.

Step 2:
Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 green chili. Sauté for 1-2 mins until raw smell goes away.

Step 3:
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, and 1 tsp coriander powder. Cook until tomatoes turn soft and oil separates.

Step 4:
Add diced potatoes and mix well. Pour 1 cup water and cover the lid. Cook on medium flame for 10 mins.

Step 5:
Add green peas and cook for another 5-7 mins until potatoes and peas are soft.

Step 6:
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Potato, fenugreek leaves, chillies, salt, oil
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them crackle. Add chopped garlic and sauté until golden.

Step 2:
Add diced potatoes, turmeric powder, and salt. Cook on medium flame for 8-10 mins until potatoes are half cooked.

Step 3:
Add chopped methi leaves and mix well. Cook for 5 mins until methi starts releasing water.

Step 4:
Add red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Mix everything and cook until potatoes are fully cooked and methi becomes dry.

Step 5:
Sprinkle garam masala and lemon juice. Mix well and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Potato, Capsicum, garam masala, amchur powder, salt
column5:
Steps:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add sliced onion and sauté until golden brown.

Step 2:
Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and green chili. Sauté for 1 minute.

Step 3:
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes turn soft and oil separates.

Step 4:
Add diced potatoes and cover the lid. Cook on low flame for 10 mins, stirring occasionally.

Step 5:
Add diced capsicum and mix well. Cook for 7-8 mins until both potatoes and capsicum are soft.

Step 6:
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Rice flour, potato, bread crumbs, garam masala, salt
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, take 4 boiled & mashed potatoes, add 2 green chilies (finely chopped), 1 tsp grated ginger, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp cumin powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, and salt to taste. Mix well.

Step 2:
Add 2 tbsp cornstarch or breadcrumbs to bind the mixture. Knead into a soft dough.

Step 3:
Grease your hands with oil and shape the mixture into small round flat tikkis.

Step 4:
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry the tikkis on medium flame until golden and crispy on both sides.

Step 5:
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

column2: Sugar, milk, nuts
column5:
Step1: Boil 1 liter full cream milk in a heavy-bottom pan on medium flame, stirring continuously.
Step2: Simmer the milk on low flame until it thickens and reduces to half, stirring occasionally.
Step3: Add 1/2 cup sugar, 1/2 tsp cardamom powder, and soaked saffron strands. Mix well.
Step4: Add chopped almonds, pistachios, and cashews. Simmer for 5-7 more minutes.
Step5: Let it cool slightly, garnish with dry fruits, and serve warm or chilled.

column2: Chole, rava, yogurt, plain flour, baking soda
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp semolina, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt.

Step 2:
Add 2 tbsp curd and 2 tbsp oil. Mix well.

Step 3:
Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Cover and rest for 2 hours.

Step 4:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll into round or oval bhatura shapes.

Step 5:
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry each bhatura on medium flame until golden and puffy.

Step 6:
Drain excess oil and serve hot with chole or pickle.

column2: Lady Finger, garam masala, kasuri methi, tomatoes, chili powder
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter.

Step 2:
Add 1 sliced onion and sauté until golden brown. Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 chopped green chili, sauté for 1 minute.

Step 3:
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes turn soft.

Step 4:
Add chopped bhindi and cook on medium flame for 10-12 mins, stirring occasionally.

Step 5:
Sprinkle 1/2 tsp garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Fish (Rohu/Catla), tomatoes, green chilies, onion, turmeric powder, mustard seeds, garlic, ginger paste, mustard oil, salt, coriander leaves, water.
column5:
Step 1 Marinate Fish
Marinate 4-5 fish pieces with 1/2 tsp turmeric powder and salt. Keep aside for 10 mins

Step 2 Fry Fish
Heat 4 tbsp mustard oil in a pan
Fry the marinated fish pieces until golden brown on both sides and keep aside

Step 3 Tempering
In the same oil, add 1 tsp mustard seeds and let them splutter
Add 3 crushed garlic cloves and fry for a few seconds

Step 4 Onion & Tomatoes
Add 1 sliced onion and fry until golden brown
Add 3 chopped tomatoes, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, and salt
Cook until tomatoes turn soft and mushy

Step 5 Simmer
Add 2 cups water and 2 green chilies
Let the gravy simmer for 3-4 mins

Step 6 Add Fish
Gently add the fried fish into the gravy
Cook for 5-6 mins on low flame

Step 7 Garnish
Sprinkle chopped coriander leaves and turn off the flame

column2: Chicken thighs, basmati rice, star anise, sweet, green chillies
column5:
Step 1 Marinate Chicken
Mix 500g chicken, 1 cup curd, 1 tbsp red chili powder, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, 2 tbsp lemon juice, salt, and 2 tbsp mustard oil
Keep aside for 1-2 hours

Step 2 Cook Rice
Boil 2 cups basmati rice with 4-5 cloves, 3-4 cardamom, 1 cinnamon stick, 2 bay leaves, and 1 tsp salt until 70% cooked
Drain and keep aside

Step 3 Fry Onions
Heat 4 tbsp oil
Fry 3 sliced onions until golden brown
Keep half aside for garnishing

Step 4 Cook Chicken
In the same oil, add 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and salt
Cook until soft, then add marinated chicken
Cook for 15-20 mins until tender

Step 5 Layering
In a pot, layer half chicken, half cooked rice, fried onions, mint leaves, and coriander leaves
Repeat layers and drizzle 3 tbsp ghee

Step 6 Dum Cooking
Cover and cook on low flame for 20-25 mins

Step 7 Serve
Enjoy hot Chicken Biryani with raita

column2: Brown rice, soy sauce, olive oil
column5:
Step 1:
Rinse 1 cup brown rice in water 2-3 times to remove excess starch.

Step 2:
In a pan, add 3 cups water, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tsp oil. Bring to boil.

Step 3:
Add rinsed brown rice and cook on medium flame. Cover with a lid.

Step 4:
Simmer for 30-35 mins until rice is soft and water is absorbed.

Step 5:
Turn off the flame and let it rest for 5 mins. Fluff the rice with a fork.

column2: Chicken, greek yogurt, cream, garam masala powder, cashew nuts, butter
column5:
Step 1 Marinate Chicken
Mix 500g chicken with 1 cup curd, 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tbsp lemon juice, and salt
Keep aside for 1 hour

Step 2 Fry Chicken
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan
Fry marinated chicken until golden brown and cooked

Step 3 Prepare Gravy
In the same pan, heat 2 tbsp butter
Add 1 tbsp ginger garlic paste and sauté for a few seconds
Add 2 chopped onions and fry until golden brown
Add 3 chopped tomatoes and cook until soft
Grind soaked cashew nuts into a paste and add to the mixture
Add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and salt

Step 4 Blend Gravy
Cool the mixture and blend into a smooth paste
Return to the pan and cook for 5 mins

Step 5 Add Chicken
Add fried chicken pieces to the gravy
Add 1/2 cup fresh cream and 2 tbsp tomato ketchup
Cook for 10 mins

Step 6 Garnish
Sprinkle garam masala and chopped coriander leaves

column2: Chickpeas, tomato paste, garam masala, ginger, red onion, avocado oil
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 1 cup soaked chickpeas in a pressure cooker with 3 cups water and salt for 4-5 whistles or until soft. (Skip if using canned chickpeas).

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter.

Step 3:
Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until golden brown. Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 chopped green chili, sauté for 1 minute.

Step 4:
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and 1 tsp cumin powder. Cook until tomatoes are soft and oil separates.

Step 5:
Add boiled chickpeas along with water, mix well, and simmer for 10-12 mins until thick gravy forms.

Step 6:
Sprinkle 1 tsp chana masala or garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Whole wheat flour, olive oil, hot water, all purpose flour
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 2 cups whole wheat flour and 1/2 tsp salt.

Step 2:
Gradually add 3/4 cup water and knead into a soft dough. Add 1 tsp oil if needed. Rest the dough for 20-30 mins.

Step 3:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into thin round chapati.

Step 4:
Heat a tawa or pan. Cook each chapati for 30-40 secs on one side until bubbles appear, flip and cook for 30-40 secs on the other side.

Step 5:
Flip again and press lightly with a spatula until it puffs up.

Step 6:
Serve hot with curry, sabzi, or dal.

column2: Chicken, dahi, sesame seeds, garam masala powder, cashew nuts, saffron
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 500g chicken with ½ cup yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger paste, 1 tbsp garlic paste, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp white pepper powder, and salt to taste. Let it rest for 30 minutes.

Step 2:
Grind 1 tbsp poppy seeds and 8 cashew nuts into a fine paste using a little water. Set aside.

Step 3:
Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pan and add 2 bay leaves, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 3 cloves, 3 green cardamoms, and 6 black peppercorns. Sauté for a few seconds until aromatic.

Step 4:
Add 2 medium sliced onions and sauté until soft and translucent (not browned).

Step 5:
Add the marinated chicken and cook on medium heat until it turns white and releases moisture.

Step 6:
Pour the poppy seed-cashew paste into the pan and mix well. Cook for 3-4 minutes until the raw smell disappears.

Step 7:
Add ¼ cup water, cover the pan, and let the chicken cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Step 8:
Once the chicken is fully cooked, add 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp kewra water, and ½ tsp sugar for a balanced flavor.

Step 9:
Pour in ¼ cup fresh cream and mix well. Simmer for 2-3 minutes until you get a creamy consistency.

Step 10:
Garnish with 2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan, paratha, or steamed rice.

column2: Naan bread, tomato sauce, skinless chicken breasts, heavy cream, garam masala
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 500g boneless chicken cubes with ½ cup thick yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp oil, and salt to taste. Mix well and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (or overnight for best flavor).

Step 2:
Preheat a grill pan or oven. Skewer the marinated chicken and grill or bake at 200°C (400°F) for 15-20 minutes, flipping halfway, until slightly charred and cooked through. Set aside.

Step 3:
Heat 2 tbsp butter or oil in a pan. Add 1 large finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.

Step 4:
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

Step 5:
Pour in 2 large pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil starts to separate.

Step 6:
Add 1 tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, ½ tsp cumin powder, and ½ tsp garam masala. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 7:
Add ½ cup water and simmer the gravy for 5 minutes.

Step 8:
Add the grilled chicken tikka to the gravy and stir well. Cook for 5 minutes on low heat.

Step 9:
Crush 1 tbsp kasuri methi between your palms and add it to the curry. Pour in ¼ cup fresh cream and mix well. Simmer for 2 minutes.

Step 10:
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan, roti, or steamed rice.

column2: Chole, bhatura, garam masala, bay leaf, cinnamon stick
column5:
Step 1 (Chole):
Pressure cook 1 cup soaked chickpeas with 3 cups water and salt for 4-5 whistles until soft.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds. Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.

Step 3:
Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 chopped green chili, and sauté for 1 min.

Step 4:
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and 1 tsp cumin powder. Cook until oil separates.

Step 5:
Add boiled chickpeas with water and simmer for 10-12 mins. Add 1 tsp chana masala and garnish with coriander leaves.

Step 6 (Bhature):
In a bowl, mix 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tbsp semolina, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1/4 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt.

Step 7:
Add 2 tbsp curd and 2 tbsp oil. Gradually add water and knead into a soft dough. Rest for 2 hours.

Step 8:
Divide into small balls, roll into round bhature.

Step 9:
Deep fry in hot oil until puffy and golden.

column2: Whole wheat flour, khus khus, sesame seeds, dry coconut, gur
column5:
Step1: Mix wheat flour, semolina, and 2 tbsp ghee in a bowl. Add water and knead a stiff dough.
Step2: Shape the dough into small oval rolls (muthia).
Step3: Deep fry the muthia in ghee on low flame until golden and crisp. Let them cool.
Step4: Crush and grind the fried muthia into coarse powder (churma).
Step5: Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and chopped dry fruits. Mix well.
Step6: Pour melted ghee and mix until the mixture binds.
Step7: Shape into small laddus and serve.

column2: Condensed milk, mawa, desiccated coconut, almonds, cashews
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, combine 1 cup grated coconut, ½ cup semolina (rava), 1 small finely chopped onion, 2 chopped green chilies, 1 tsp grated ginger, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves, and salt to taste. Mix well.

Step 2:
Add a little water gradually to form a thick dough-like mixture. Let it rest for 10-15 minutes to allow the semolina to absorb the moisture.

Step 3:
Grease your hands with oil, take a small portion of the mixture, roll it into a ball, and flatten into a vada shape.

Step 4:
Heat oil in a pan and fry the vadas on medium flame until they turn golden and crispy.

Step 5:
Serve hot with coconut chutney or tomato ketchup.

column2: Moong dal, masoor dal, chana dal, wheat flour, almond
column5:
Step 1 (Dal):
Boil 1/2 cup chana dal, 1/2 cup toor dal, and 1/4 cup moong dal with 3 cups water, turmeric, and salt in a pressure cooker for 3-4 whistles.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp ghee, add 1 tsp cumin seeds. Add chopped onion, sauté till golden. Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 chopped green chili.

Step 3:
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and cook till soft. Add boiled dal and simmer for 10 mins.

Step 4:
Sprinkle 1/2 tsp garam masala and garnish with coriander leaves.

Step 5 (Baati):
Mix 2 cups wheat flour, 1/4 cup semolina, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp ajwain. Add 1/4 cup ghee and knead with water into a stiff dough.

Step 6:
Make small round balls and bake at 180°C for 30-35 mins until golden.

Step 7 (Churma):
Mix 1 cup wheat flour, 2 tbsp semolina, and 2 tbsp ghee into crumbly dough. Make small balls and deep fry until golden.

Step 8:
Cool and crush into powder. Add 1/4 cup powdered sugar, 2 tbsp almonds, and 1/2 tsp cardamom powder.

column2: Whole wheat flour, dal, kokum, gur, bengal gram flour
column5:
Step 1 (Dal):
Pressure cook 1 cup toor dal with 4 cups water, 1 tsp turmeric powder, and salt for 3-4 whistles until soft.

Step 2:
Mash the dal, add chopped tomato, 2 tbsp peanuts, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1 tsp jaggery, and tamarind pulp. Simmer for 10 mins.

Step 3 (Dhokli):
Mix 1 cup wheat flour, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/4 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp ajwain, salt, and 1 tsp oil. Knead into a firm dough.

Step 4:
Roll the dough thin and cut into small diamond or square shapes.

Step 5 (Cooking Dhokli):
Add the dhokli pieces directly into the boiling dal and cook on low flame for 10-12 mins, stirring occasionally.

Step 6 (Tempering):
Heat 2 tbsp ghee, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, chopped green chili, curry leaves, and hing. Pour over the dal.

Step 7:
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with ghee or pickle!

column2: Urad dal, bhuna chana, garam masala, dates, tamarind
column5:
Step 1: Soak 1 cup urad dal for 4-6 hours, grind into a smooth thick batter using little water.

Step 2: Add salt, 1 tsp grated ginger, 1-2 chopped green chilies, and 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves to the batter, mix well.

Step 3: Heat oil, shape the batter into small balls, and deep fry until golden brown.

Step 4: Soak fried vadas in warm water for 15-20 minutes, then squeeze out extra water.

Step 5: Whisk 2 cups curd with ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp sugar, and ½ tsp roasted cumin powder until smooth.

Step 6: Place vadas in a bowl, pour curd mixture over them, and garnish with red chili powder, cumin powder, chaat masala, and coriander leaves.

column2: Red kidney beans, urad dal, cream, garam masala, chili powder
column5:
Step 1 (Boil Dal):
Pressure cook 1/2 cup urad dal and 1/4 cup rajma with 3 cups water and salt for 6-7 whistles until soft.

Step 2 (Tempering):
Heat 2 tbsp butter and 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 1 bay leaf.

Step 3:
Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until golden brown. Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 min.

Step 4:
Add pureed tomatoes, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.

Step 5:
Add the boiled dal and simmer for 20 mins on low flame, stirring occasionally.

Step 6:
Add 1/4 cup cream and 1/2 tsp garam masala. Cook for 5 mins more.

Step 7:
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves, butter, and cream.

column2: Pigeon peas, garam masala, ginger, red onion, kasuri methi
column5:
Step 1 (Boil Dal):
Rinse 1/2 cup toor dal and 1/4 cup moong dal. Pressure cook with 3 cups water, 1 tomato, 1 green chili, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, and salt for 3-4 whistles until soft.

Step 2:
Mash the cooked dal and simmer for 5 mins on low flame.

Step 3 (Tadka):
Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 dry red chili, and asafoetida.

Step 4:
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden. Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and few curry leaves. Cook for 1 min.

Step 5:
Add 1/2 tsp red chili powder and pour this tempering over the simmered dal.

Step 6:
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Rava, coconut, gram flour, mustard, sesame
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 1 cup besan (gram flour), ½ cup curd, ½ cup water, ½ tsp turmeric powder, ½ tsp salt, and 1 tsp ginger-green chili paste to form a smooth batter.

Step 2: Add 1 tsp lemon juice and 1 tsp sugar to the batter, mix well and let it rest for 15-20 minutes.

Step 3: Just before steaming, add 1 tsp eno fruit salt or ½ tsp baking soda, mix gently.

Step 4: Pour the batter into a greased steaming plate and steam for 15-20 minutes on medium flame.

Step 5: In a small pan, heat 1 tbsp oil, add ½ tsp mustard seeds, few curry leaves, and 2 chopped green chilies, sauté for a few seconds.

Step 6: Pour the tempering over steamed dhokla and garnish with fresh coriander leaves and grated coconut.

column2: Rice, urad dal, fenugreek seeds, salt, water, oil, poha (optional), cooked rice (optional).
column5:
Step 1: Soak 1 cup rice, ½ cup urad dal, and ¼ tsp fenugreek seeds in water for 4-6 hours.

Step 2: Grind soaked ingredients into a smooth batter, add salt and let it ferment overnight for 8-12 hours.

Step 3: Stir the fermented batter and add little water if needed to get a pouring consistency.

Step 4: Heat a tawa, pour a ladleful of batter, and spread it in a circular motion to form a thin dosa.

Step 5: Drizzle oil or ghee around the edges and cook until golden and crispy.

Step 6: Fold and serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar!

column2: Baby potatoes, garam masala, cashew nuts, kasuri methi, tomatoes
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, shallow fry boiled baby potatoes until golden brown. Keep aside.

Step 2:
In the same pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 1 bay leaf. Sauté for 30 secs.

Step 3:
Add chopped onion and sauté until golden brown. Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 min.

Step 4:
Add tomato puree, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, and 1 tsp coriander powder. Cook until oil separates.

Step 5:
Lower the flame, add whisked curd gradually while stirring.

Step 6:
Add fried potatoes, salt, and 1/2 cup water. Cover and simmer for 10 mins on low flame.

Step 7:
Add 1/2 tsp garam masala and 2 tbsp fresh cream. Cook for 2 mins more.

Step 8:
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Carrots, milk, sugar, ghee, cashews, raisins
column5:
Step 1:
Wash, peel, and grate 1 kg carrots (gajar).

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pan, add grated carrots, and sauté for 5-7 minutes on medium flame until they become soft.

Step 3:
Pour 1 liter milk into the pan and cook on low flame, stirring occasionally, until the milk starts reducing.

Step 4:
Once the milk is reduced to half, add 1 cup sugar and mix well. Cook until the mixture thickens.

Step 5:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and 2 tbsp chopped dry fruits (almonds, cashews) and cook for another 5-7 minutes.

Step 6:
Turn off the flame and garnish with more dry fruits.

Step 7:
Serve hot or chilled as per your choice.

column2: Flour, ghee, kewra, milk, clarified butter, sugar, almonds, pistachio, saffron, green cardamom
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour (maida), 2 tbsp ghee, and a pinch of saffron or yellow food color.

Step 2:
Add ½ cup cold milk and mix well to form a smooth batter. Gradually add 1 cup chilled water to make a thin, flowing consistency batter.

Step 3:
Heat ghee or oil in a deep pan for frying. Pour a small ladle of batter from a height into the hot ghee in the center. The batter will spread on its own.

Step 4:
Let it cook on medium flame until golden and crispy. Remove and drain excess oil.

Step 5:
In another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling 1 cup sugar and ½ cup water until it forms a 1-string consistency. Add ½ tsp cardamom powder.

Step 6:
Dip the fried ghevar in sugar syrup or pour the syrup over it.

Step 7:
Garnish with chopped dry fruits, saffron strands, and silver vark.

Step 8:
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

column2: Milk powder, plain flour, baking powder, ghee, milk, sugar, water, rose water
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup milk powder, ¼ cup all-purpose flour (maida), 2 tbsp ghee, and a pinch of baking soda.

Step 2:
Add 2-3 tbsp milk gradually and knead into a soft dough. Let it rest for 10 minutes.

Step 3:
Divide the dough into small balls without cracks and keep aside.

Step 4:
Heat oil or ghee on low flame and fry the balls until they turn golden brown.

Step 5:
In another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling 1 cup sugar, 1 cup water, and 2-3 cardamom pods for 10 minutes. Add rose water or saffron strands.

Step 6:
Dip the fried gulab jamuns in hot sugar syrup for at least 1-2 hours.

Step 7:
Serve warm or chilled with garnished chopped dry fruits.

column2: Rice flour, hot water, grated coconut
column5:
Step 1: Boil 1 cup water with ½ tsp salt and 1 tsp oil.

Step 2: Add hot water gradually to 1 cup rice flour, mix with a spoon to form a soft dough.

Step 3: Grease the idiyappam maker, fill it with dough, and press into thin noodles onto greased idli plates or steamer plates.

Step 4: Steam for 10-12 minutes on medium flame until cooked.

Step 5: Serve hot with coconut milk, sugar, or vegetable stew!

column2: Rava, curd, water, mustard seeds, curry leaves, green chilies, ginger, coriander leaves, salt, baking soda, oil, cashew nuts (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil or ghee in a pan.
Add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp chana dal, 1 tsp urad dal, and 10 cashew nuts (optional).
Once they splutter, add 2 chopped green chilies, 1 tsp grated ginger, and 8-10 chopped curry leaves.

Step 2:
Add 1 cup rava (semolina) to the pan and roast on low flame for 3-4 mins until aromatic.
Let it cool completely.

Step 3:
In a mixing bowl, add roasted rava, 1/2 cup curd, 1/4 cup grated carrot, 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, and salt to taste.
Add water little by little to make a thick batter.
Rest the batter for 15-20 mins.

Step 4:
Just before steaming, add 1/2 tsp Eno fruit salt or baking soda to the batter.
Mix gently (do not overmix).

Step 5:
Grease idli moulds with oil.
Pour the batter into the moulds.
Steam for 12-15 mins on medium flame.

Step 6:
Let the idlis cool for 2 mins.
Remove from the mould and serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar.

column2: Maida, corn flour, baking soda, vinegar, curd, water, turmeric, saffron, cardamom
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour (maida), 2 tbsp cornflour, ½ tsp baking powder, and a pinch of turmeric powder (for color).

Step 2:
Add ½ cup curd (yogurt) and water gradually to make a thick, smooth batter. Rest the batter for 6-8 hours for fermentation.

Step 3:
Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Fill the batter in a piping bag or squeeze bottle with a small nozzle.

Step 4:
Squeeze the batter in hot oil in circular spiral shapes. Fry on medium flame until golden and crispy.

Step 5:
In another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling 1 cup sugar, ½ cup water, and ½ tsp cardamom powder for 8-10 minutes until it reaches 1-string consistency. Add few saffron strands and rose water.

Step 6:
Dip the fried jalebis in warm sugar syrup for 1-2 minutes and take them out.

Step 7:
Serve hot with rabri or enjoy plain!

column2: Green chilies, lemon juice, chili powder, boiled potatoes
column5:
Step 1: Cut boiled potatoes into cubes.
Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Step 3: Add chopped green chili and grated ginger. Sauté for 30 secs.
Step 4: Add 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, and 1 tsp coriander powder. Mix well.
Step 5: Add cubed potatoes and salt. Toss everything and cook for 5-7 mins on medium flame.
Step 6: Add 1/2 tsp garam masala and 1 tsp lemon juice. Mix well.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Moong dal, rava, garam masala, dough, fennel seeds
column5:
Step 1:
Mix 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp salt, and 3 tbsp oil in a bowl.
Add water gradually and knead a soft dough. Rest for 30 mins.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan.
Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 1 tsp fennel seeds.
Add coarsely ground 1 cup moong dal and sauté for 3-4 mins.

Step 3:
Add 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp dry mango powder, and salt to taste.
Cook for 5-6 mins until dry. Add 2 tbsp coriander leaves and let it cool.

Step 4:
Divide the dough into small balls.
Roll each ball, stuff with filling, seal edges, and flatten lightly.

Step 5:
Deep fry on low-medium flame until golden brown.

Step 6:
Serve hot with tamarind chutney or green chutney.

column2: Cottage cheese, bell peppers, gravy, garam masala, cashew nuts
column5:
Step 1: Blend 2 tomatoes, 1 onion, 2 garlic cloves, 1-inch ginger, and 2 green chilies into a smooth paste.
Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 1 tsp crushed coriander seeds, and sauté for 30 secs.
Step 3: Add the blended paste and cook for 7-8 mins until oil separates.
Step 4: Add 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2 mins.
Step 5: Add cubed onions and capsicum, cook for 3-4 mins.
Step 6: Add paneer cubes, 1 tsp garam masala, and 1 tsp kasuri methi. Mix and cook for 2 mins.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

column2: Besan, garam masala powder, gram flour, ginger, curry leaves
column5:
Step 1: Mix 1 cup gram flour, onion, green chili, 1/2 tsp red chili powder, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, cumin seeds, salt, and water to make a thick batter.
Step 2: Heat oil in a pan and deep fry small portions of the batter until golden brown. Keep aside.
Step 3: In a bowl, whisk 1 cup curd, 3 tbsp gram flour, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt with 3 cups water until smooth.
Step 4: Pour the mixture into a pan and cook on low flame for 15-20 mins, stirring occasionally.
Step 5: Add the fried pakoras and cook for 5 mins.
Step 6: Heat 2 tbsp oil, add cumin seeds, mustard seeds, dry red chilies, hing, and curry leaves. Pour over the kadhi.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Cashews, ghee, cardamom, sugar
column5:
Step 1:
Grind 1 cup cashews (kaju) into a fine powder using a blender (make sure cashews are dry).

Step 2:
In a pan, add ½ cup sugar and ¼ cup water. Cook on medium flame until it forms 1-string consistency sugar syrup.

Step 3:
Add the powdered cashews to the sugar syrup and stir continuously on low flame until the mixture thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan.

Step 4:
Add 1 tsp ghee and ½ tsp cardamom powder. Mix well and turn off the flame.

Step 5:
Let the mixture cool slightly, then knead into a soft dough using greased hands.

Step 6:
Roll the dough into a thin sheet using a rolling pin on butter paper.

Step 7:
Cut into diamond shapes and garnish with silver vark (optional).

Step 8:
Let it cool completely and serve!

column2: Milk, cottage cheese, sugar
column5:
Step 1:
In a pan, crumble 2 cups paneer (cottage cheese) or grated khoya.

Step 2:
Add 1 cup condensed milk and cook on low flame, stirring continuously.

Step 3:
Cook until the mixture thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan (10-12 minutes).

Step 4:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and mix well. Turn off the flame.

Step 5:
Grease a tray with ghee and pour the mixture into the tray. Flatten evenly.

Step 6:
Garnish with chopped almonds, pistachios, and saffron strands.

Step 7:
Let it set for 1-2 hours in the refrigerator.

Step 8:
Cut into squares and serve chilled or at room temperature.

column2: Carrot, yellow mustard, red chilli, black salt
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 1 liter water and let it cool to lukewarm.

Step 2:
Add 2 tbsp mustard powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp turmeric powder to the water.

Step 3:
Peel and cut 2 carrots (preferably black or red) into thin sticks. Add them to the water.

Step 4:
Cover the jar with a muslin cloth and keep it under sunlight for 2-3 days for fermentation. Stir once daily.

Step 5:
Once sour and tangy, refrigerate and serve chilled.

column2: Whole wheat flour, low fat, bengal gram flour
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup whole wheat flour, 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp cumin seeds, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1 tbsp oil.

Step 2:
Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. Rest for 15 mins.

Step 3:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each into thin round chapatis.

Step 4:
Cook on a hot tawa on low flame, pressing with a cloth or spatula until crispy and golden brown.

Step 5:
Apply a little oil or ghee if needed.

Step 6:
Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

column2: Yogurt, fresh coconut, sesame seeds, semolina, gram flour
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup gram flour (besan), 1 tbsp semolina (rava), 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp turmeric powder.

Step 2:
Add 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp oil, and water gradually to make a smooth batter. Rest for 10 mins.

Step 3:
Add 1 tsp Eno fruit salt or 1/2 tsp baking soda to the batter. Mix gently until fluffy.

Step 4:
Pour the batter into a greased plate and steam for 12-15 mins on medium flame.

Step 5:
For tempering, heat 1 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp sesame seeds, 2 green chilies (slit), and few curry leaves. Pour over steamed khaman.

Step 6:
Garnish with fresh coriander and grated coconut. Serve with green chutney.

column2: Green chili paste, white sesame seeds, gram flour, curry leaves, green chili
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup gram flour (besan), 1 cup curd, 2 cups water, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp ginger-green chili paste, and salt to taste. Whisk well without lumps.

Step 2:
Cook the mixture in a non-stick pan on low flame, stirring continuously until thick (about 10-12 mins).

Step 3:
Spread the hot mixture thinly on a greased plate or back of a steel plate. Let it cool for 5 mins.

Step 4:
Cut into strips and roll them tightly into spirals.

Step 5:
For tempering, heat 1 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, few curry leaves, and 2 green chilies (slit). Pour over khandvi rolls.

Step 6:
Garnish with grated coconut and chopped coriander leaves. Serve with green chutney.

column2: Milk, rice, sugar, dried fruits
column5:
Step 1:
Wash and soak ¼ cup basmati rice in water for 30 minutes.

Step 2:
In a pan, boil 1 liter full cream milk on medium flame, stirring occasionally.

Step 3:
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the boiling milk. Cook on low flame, stirring continuously until the rice becomes soft (20-25 minutes).

Step 4:
Add ½ cup sugar and stir until the sugar dissolves completely.

Step 5:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder, chopped almonds, cashews, and raisins. Mix well.

Step 6:
Cook for another 5-10 minutes until the kheer thickens.

Step 7:
Turn off the flame and garnish with saffron strands and chopped pistachios.

Step 8:
Serve hot or chilled.

column2: Moong dal, green peas, ginger, tomato, green chili
column5:
Step 1: Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a pressure cooker, add 1/2 tsp cumin seeds and asafoetida. Let them splutter.
Step 2: Add grated ginger, chopped onion, and green chili. Sauté for 2 mins.
Step 3: Add chopped tomato, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Step 4: Add washed rice and moong dal. Sauté for 1 min.
Step 5: Pour 3 cups water and pressure cook for 3-4 whistles on medium flame.
Step 6: Let the pressure release naturally, then mix gently.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

column2: Paneer, potato, cream, corn flour, garam masala
column5:
Step 1: Mix mashed potatoes, grated paneer, corn flour, green chili, red chili powder, garam masala, and salt to form a dough.
Step 2: Make small balls and deep fry them until golden brown. Keep aside.
Step 3: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and sauté. Add chopped onions and cook until golden.
Step 4: Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 min.
Step 5: Add tomato puree, cashew paste, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 6: Add 1/2 cup water and simmer for 5 mins.
Step 7: Add garam masala and cream. Cook for 2 mins.
Step 8: Add koftas to the gravy and cook for 2 mins.
Step 9: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Makki ka atta (maize flour), warm water, salt, ghee or butter (for cooking), optional ajwain (carom seeds) or finely chopped green chili for flavor.
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 2 cups maize flour, salt, and 1 tsp carom seeds.
Step 2: Add warm water gradually and knead into a soft dough.
Step 3: Take a small portion of dough, roll into a ball, and flatten using your hands or a rolling pin between two plastic sheets.
Step 4: Heat a tawa, place the roti, and cook on medium flame until golden brown spots appear. Flip and cook the other side.
Step 5: Apply ghee or butter on top.

column2: Yoghurt, refined flour, ghee, fennel seeds
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour (maida), ¼ cup semolina (rava), 2 tbsp sugar, and ½ tsp fennel seeds.

Step 2:
Add ½ cup milk gradually and whisk to form a smooth, thick batter. Let it rest for 30 minutes.

Step 3:
In another pan, prepare sugar syrup by boiling 1 cup sugar and ½ cup water until it reaches 1-string consistency. Add cardamom powder and saffron strands.

Step 4:
Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Pour a small ladle of batter into the hot oil and fry on medium flame until both sides turn golden brown and crispy.

Step 5:
Dip the hot malpuas in the warm sugar syrup for 1-2 minutes.

Step 6:
Garnish with chopped dry fruits and saffron strands.

Step 7:
Serve hot with rabri or as it is!

column2: Chana dal, urad dal, potatoes, idli rice, thick poha
column5:
Step 1:
Soak 1 cup rice, 1/4 cup urad dal, and 1 tbsp fenugreek seeds in water for 6 hours.

Step 2:
Grind to a smooth batter, add salt, and ferment overnight for 8-10 hours.

Step 3:
For the filling, heat 2 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, and few curry leaves. Add 1 chopped onion, 2 green chilies, and 1 tsp ginger paste.

Step 4:
Add 2 boiled, mashed potatoes, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, salt, and 2 tbsp coriander leaves. Cook for 2-3 mins.

Step 5:
Heat a tawa, pour batter, and spread into a thin circle. Drizzle little oil around the edges and cook till crispy.

Step 6:
Place the potato filling in the center, fold, and serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

column2: Whole wheat flour, chickpea flour, green chilies
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 1 cup wheat flour, 1 cup gram flour, onion, green chili, cumin seeds, ajwain, red chili powder, turmeric powder, salt, and fresh coriander leaves.
Step 2: Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. Rest for 10 mins.
Step 3: Divide the dough into small balls and roll into rotis.
Step 4: Heat a tawa and cook the roti on medium flame until golden brown spots appear on both sides.
Step 5: Apply ghee or butter on top.

column2: Milk, jaggery
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 1 liter full cream milk on medium flame until it reduces to ¾ quantity. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.

Step 2:
Add ½ cup sugar and cook until the sugar dissolves completely. You can caramelize the sugar separately for a richer flavor.

Step 3:
Let the milk cool until it becomes lukewarm.

Step 4:
Add 2 tbsp curd (yogurt) as a starter and mix gently.

Step 5:
Pour the mixture into clay pots or bowls for an authentic flavor.

Step 6:
Cover and let it set for 8-10 hours in a warm place.

Step 7:
Once set, refrigerate for 1-2 hours before serving.

Step 8:
Garnish with chopped dry fruits or saffron strands and serve chilled.

column2: Rice flour, coconut, jaggery
column5:
Step 1:
In a pan, heat 1 tsp ghee and add 1 cup grated coconut and ½ cup jaggery.

Step 2:
Cook on low flame until the jaggery melts and the mixture becomes thick. Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and chopped dry fruits. Let it cool.

Step 3:
In another pan, boil 1 cup water with a pinch of salt and 1 tsp ghee.

Step 4:
Add 1 cup rice flour gradually and stir until it forms a soft dough.

Step 5:
Let the dough cool slightly, then knead it until smooth.

Step 6:
Grease your hands, take small portions of dough, and shape into small cups. Fill with coconut jaggery mixture and seal the edges.

Step 7:
Steam the modaks in a steamer for 10-15 minutes until they become shiny and soft.

Step 8:
Serve hot with ghee on top.

column2: Mushroom, malai, garam masala, ginger, capsicum
column5:
Step 1: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Step 2: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, cook for 1 min.
Step 4: Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 5: Add sliced mushrooms and cook for 7-8 mins until soft.
Step 6: Add cubed onions, garam masala, and kasuri methi. Cook for 2 mins.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Canned coconut milk, frozen green peas, wild mushrooms, garam masala, tomatoes
column5:
Step 1: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Step 2: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, cook for 1 min.
Step 4: Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 5: Add sliced mushrooms and cook for 5-6 mins.
Step 6: Add boiled peas, garam masala, and kasuri methi. Cook for 3 mins.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Whole wheat flour, honey, butter, garlic
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 2 cups flour, baking powder, baking soda, sugar, and salt.
Step 2: Add curd and oil, then knead the dough using water into a soft texture. Rest for 1 hour.
Step 3: Divide dough into small balls, roll into oval or round shapes.
Step 4: Heat a tawa, place the naan, and cook on medium flame until bubbles form.
Step 5: Flip and cook the other side until golden spots appear.
Step 6: Brush with butter and garnish with coriander leaves.

column2: Cottage cheese, palak, cream, garam masala, butter
column5:
Step 1: Boil chopped spinach in water for 3-4 mins. Drain, cool, and blend into a smooth paste.
Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, then sauté garlic, ginger, and green chili for 30 secs.
Step 3: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden.
Step 4: Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 5: Add the spinach paste and cook for 3-4 mins on low flame.
Step 6: Add paneer cubes and garam masala. Simmer for 2 mins.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh cream and serve hot.

column2: Paneer, whipping cream, garam masala, cashew nuts, butter
column5:
Step 1: Heat 2 tbsp butter in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Step 2: Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 min.
Step 4: Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 5: Add paneer cubes and kasuri methi, cook for 3-4 mins on low flame.
Step 6: Add garam masala and fresh cream, cook for 2 mins.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Paneer, greek yogurt, tandoori masala, cream, bell pepper
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix curd, ginger-garlic paste, besan, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, chaat masala, lemon juice, oil, and salt to make a marinade.
Step 2: Add paneer cubes, capsicum, onion, and tomato into the marinade. Mix gently and let it rest for 30 mins.
Step 3: Preheat a tawa or grill, grease with oil, and place the marinated paneer and veggies.
Step 4: Cook on medium flame, turning sides until golden brown and slightly charred.
Step 5: Sprinkle chaat masala and lemon juice before serving.

column2: Black chana, mashed potato, boondi, semolina, lemon
column5:
Step 1:
For Puris, mix 1 cup semolina (rava), 2 tbsp all-purpose flour (maida), salt, and water. Knead into a stiff dough. Rest for 15 mins, roll thin, cut small circles, and deep fry until crispy.

Step 2:
For Spicy Pani, blend 1 cup mint leaves, 1/2 cup coriander leaves, 1 green chili, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp chaat masala, lemon juice, and salt with water. Chill for 1 hour.

Step 3:
For Filling, mix boiled potatoes (mashed), boiled chickpeas, chopped onions, salt, cumin powder, and chili powder.

Step 4:
Crack the puris from the top.

Step 5:
Fill with potato mixture, pour spicy pani, and serve immediately.

column2: Urad dal, sev, lemon juice, chopped tomatoes
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup urad dal flour or moong dal flour, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper powder, and 1/4 tsp cumin seeds.

Step 2:
Add little water gradually and knead into a stiff dough. Rest for 20 mins.

Step 3:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each ball into thin circles using dry flour.

Step 4:
Dry the rolled papads under sunlight for 1-2 days until completely dry.

Step 5:
Store in an airtight container. Fry or roast before serving.

column2: Wheat flour, butter, potato, coriander
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix wheat flour and salt. Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. Rest for 15 mins.
Step 2: Divide the dough into small balls. Roll each ball into a circular or triangular shape.
Step 3: Heat a tawa, place the parantha, and cook for 1 min on medium flame. Flip and apply ghee or oil.
Step 4: Cook both sides until golden brown spots appear, pressing gently with a spatula.
Step 5: Serve hot with curd, pickle, or butter.

column2: Pav bhaji masala, cauliflower, potatoes, green peas, dinner rolls
column5:
Step 1: Heat 2 tbsp butter in a pan, add cumin seeds and chopped onions. Sauté until golden brown.
Step 2: Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 1 min.
Step 3: Add pureed tomatoes, turmeric powder, red chili powder, pav bhaji masala, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 4: Add boiled potatoes, cauliflower, capsicum, and peas. Mash well and cook for 10 mins.
Step 5: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and lemon wedges.

Step 6: Heat butter on a tawa, toast the pav buns until golden.

column2: Rice, cashew nuts, milk, raisins, sugar
column5:
Step 1:
In a pan, heat 1 tsp ghee and roast 2 tbsp cashews and 1 tbsp raisins until golden. Set aside.

Step 2:
In the same pan, add ½ cup vermicelli (sewai) or rice and roast on low flame until light golden.

Step 3:
Pour 3 cups milk into the pan and let it boil on medium flame. Stir occasionally.

Step 4:
Add ½ cup sugar and cook until the sugar dissolves completely.

Step 5:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and a few saffron strands. Simmer for 5-10 minutes until thick and creamy.

Step 6:
Add the roasted cashews and raisins. Mix well.

Step 7:
Turn off the flame and garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios.

Step 8:
Serve hot or chilled.

column2: Firm white pumpkin, sugar, kitchen lime, alum powder
column5:
Step 1:
Peel and cut 500g ash gourd (white pumpkin) into small cubes.

Step 2:
Boil the pumpkin pieces in water for 5-7 minutes until slightly soft, then drain the water completely.

Step 3:
Prick the pumpkin pieces with a fork to help absorb syrup.

Step 4:
In another pan, boil 1 cup sugar and ½ cup water to make 1-string consistency sugar syrup. Add ½ tsp lemon juice to remove impurities.

Step 5:
Add the boiled pumpkin pieces to the syrup and cook on low flame until the syrup is absorbed completely (20-25 minutes).

Step 6:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and few drops of rose water for extra flavor.

Step 7:
Turn off the flame and let the petha cool completely.

Step 8:
Serve or store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

column2: Beaten rice flakes, potato, curry leaves, green chilies, lemon juice
column5:
Step 1:
Wash 1 cup flattened rice (poha) in water and drain. Rest for 5 mins.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, and few curry leaves.

Step 3:
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 green chilies (chopped), and 1 tsp grated ginger. Sauté until onions turn soft.

Step 4:
Add 1/4 tsp turmeric powder, salt, and washed poha. Mix gently.

Step 5:
Cover and cook for 2 mins on low flame. Add lemon juice and 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves.

Step 6:
Garnish with roasted peanuts and serve hot.

column2: Coconut milk, prawns, garlic, turmeric, sugar
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 300g prawns with ½ tsp turmeric powder, ½ tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp salt, and 1 tbsp lemon juice. Set aside for 15 minutes.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan and add 1 tsp mustard seeds. Let them splutter.

Step 3:
Add 1 finely chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.

Step 4:
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste and 2 slit green chilies. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

Step 5:
Add 1 finely chopped tomato and cook until soft and the oil starts to separate.

Step 6:
Add ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, and ½ tsp cumin powder. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 7:
Add the marinated prawns and stir well. Cook for 3-4 minutes until the prawns turn pink and are fully cooked.

Step 8:
(Optional) Add ¼ cup coconut milk for a richer flavor. Stir well and simmer for 2 minutes.

Step 9:
Add ½ tsp garam masala and ½ tsp black pepper powder. Mix well and turn off the heat.

Step 10:
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice, roti, or naan.

column2: Condensed milk, sugar, spices, nuts
column5:
Step 1:
In a heavy-bottom pan, boil 1 liter full cream milk on medium flame, stirring occasionally.

Step 2:
Keep scraping the cream from the sides and mix it back into the milk. Let the milk reduce to ⅓ quantity.

Step 3:
Add ½ cup sugar and stir until it dissolves completely.

Step 4:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and a few saffron strands soaked in warm milk.

Step 5:
Mix in 2 tbsp chopped almonds, pistachios, and cashews.

Step 6:
Cook for another 5 minutes and turn off the flame.

Step 7:
Let it cool and refrigerate for 2-3 hours for a chilled version.

Step 8:
Serve garnished with dry fruits and rose petals.

column2: Red kidney beans, garam masala powder, ginger, tomato, mustard oil
column5:
Step 1: Pressure cook soaked rajma with salt and water for 4-5 whistles until soft.
Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste and green chili, cook for 1 min.
Step 4: Add tomato puree, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and rajma masala. Cook until oil separates.
Step 5: Add boiled rajma with its water and simmer for 10 mins. Add garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Chhena, reduced milk, pistachio
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 1 liter boiled milk with 2 tbsp lemon juice to curdle the milk. Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth and wash it with cold water. Squeeze out excess water to get chhena (paneer).

Step 2:
Knead the chhena for 5-7 minutes into a smooth dough. Make small round balls and flatten them slightly.

Step 3:
In a pan, boil 2 cups water and 1 cup sugar to make sugar syrup. Add the chhena balls and cook for 10-12 minutes on medium flame until they double in size.

Step 4:
In another pan, boil 1 liter milk until it reduces to ¾ quantity. Add ½ cup sugar, ½ tsp cardamom powder, and a few saffron strands.

Step 5:
Squeeze the chhena balls gently to remove sugar syrup and add them to the thickened milk.

Step 6:
Cook for 5-7 minutes on low flame to let the ras malai absorb the milk flavor.

Step 7:
Garnish with chopped pistachios, almonds, and saffron strands.

Step 8:
Refrigerate for 2-3 hours and serve chilled.

column2: Milk, Lemon juice or Vinegar, Water, Sugar, Cardamom pods (optional), Rose water or Kewra water (optional), Ice cubes
column5:
Step 1: Boil the Milk
Take 1 liter of full-fat milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and bring it to a boil over medium heat.

Stir the milk occasionally to ensure it doesn't stick to the bottom or burn.

Once it starts boiling, reduce the heat to low, and get ready for the next step.

Step 2: Curdling the Milk
Slowly add 2-3 tablespoons of lemon juice or vinegar (dissolved in a little water) to the hot milk, a few drops at a time. Stir gently as you add it.

The milk will begin to curdle, and the whey (the watery liquid) will separate from the curds (the solid part). This is when the milk splits into two layers — curds and whey.

If the milk doesn’t curdle fully, you can add a little more lemon juice or vinegar, but do it slowly and carefully to avoid over-curdling.

column2: Raw peanuts, sabudana, lemon, avocado oil, curry leaves, green chili
column5:
Step 1:
Wash 1 cup sabudana (sago pearls) and soak in water for 4-5 hours or overnight. Drain excess water.

Step 2:
Dry roast 1/2 cup peanuts, crush coarsely, and set aside.

Step 3:
Heat 2 tbsp ghee or oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 2 chopped green chilies.

Step 4:
Add 2 boiled, cubed potatoes and sauté for 2 mins.

Step 5:
Add soaked sabudana, crushed peanuts, salt, and 1 tsp lemon juice. Cook for 3-4 mins on low flame, stirring gently.

Step 6:
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.

column2: Pigeon peas, eggplant, drumsticks, sambar powder, tamarind
column5:
Step 1: Pressure cook toor dal with turmeric powder, salt, and water for 3-4 whistles until soft. Mash the dal.
Step 2: In a pan, boil carrot, drumsticks, and lauki with water until soft.
Step 3: Add chopped tomato, sambhar powder, tamarind water, and cooked dal. Simmer for 10 mins.
Step 4: For tempering, heat oil, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dry red chilies, curry leaves, and asafoetida. Pour over sambhar.
Step 5: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Vermicelli (sevai), parboiled rice, steamer
column5:
Step 1: Roast vermicelli (sevai) in a dry pan until golden brown and set aside.
Step 2: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Step 3: Add curry leaves, green chili, and onions, sauté until soft.
Step 4: Add carrot, peas, and turmeric powder, cook for 2-3 mins.
Step 5: Add 2 cups water and salt, bring to a boil.
Step 6: Add roasted sevai and cook until water is absorbed.
Step 7: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and lemon juice.

column2: Cottage cheese, malai, garam masala, ginger, tomato
column5:
Step 1: Blend soaked cashew nuts into a smooth paste.
Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp butter in a pan, add cumin seeds and sauté onions until golden brown.
Step 3: Add ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 min, then add tomato puree.
Step 4: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Step 5: Add cashew paste and kasuri methi, cook for 3-4 mins.
Step 6: Add paneer cubes and garam masala, cook for 2 mins.
Step 7: Add fresh cream and garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

column2: Curd, sugar, saffron, cardamom
column5:
Step 1:
Take 2 cups thick curd (yogurt) and hang it in a muslin cloth for 4-5 hours to drain excess water.

Step 2:
Transfer the thick curd to a bowl and whisk until smooth and creamy.

Step 3:
Add ½ cup powdered sugar and mix well until the sugar dissolves completely.

Step 4:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and a few saffron strands soaked in 2 tbsp warm milk for flavor and color.

Step 5:
Mix in 2 tbsp chopped almonds and pistachios.

Step 6:
Refrigerate for 2-3 hours to chill.

Step 7:
Garnish with dry fruits and rose petals before serving.

Step 8:
Serve chilled as a dessert or with puri.

column2: Gram flour, ghee, sugar, milk, cardamom
column5:
Step 1:
In a pan, heat 1 cup ghee on low flame. Add 1 cup gram flour (besan) and 1 cup all-purpose flour (maida). Roast on low flame until golden and aromatic (10-12 minutes).

Step 2:
In another pan, boil 1½ cups sugar and ½ cup water until it reaches 1-string consistency. Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and a few saffron strands.

Step 3:
Pour the hot sugar syrup into the roasted flour mixture. Stir continuously until the mixture becomes thick and starts leaving the sides of the pan.

Step 4:
Grease a tray with ghee and pour the mixture into it. Spread evenly.

Step 5:
Garnish with chopped almonds and pistachios.

Step 6:
Let it cool for 1-2 hours.

Step 7:
Cut into square or diamond shapes.

Step 8:
Serve or store in an airtight container.

column2: Greek yogurt, garam masala, kasuri methi, marinade, mustard oil
column5:
Step 1:
Make deep cuts in 500g chicken pieces for better marination.

Step 2:
In a bowl, mix ½ cup thick yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, ½ tsp garam masala, ½ tsp black pepper powder, 1 tsp kasuri methi, 1 tbsp mustard oil, and salt to taste. Add a pinch of red food color (optional).

Step 3:
Coat the chicken well with the marinade and refrigerate for at least 4 hours (overnight for best results).

Step 4:
Preheat an oven to 200°C (400°F) or heat a grill pan.

Step 5:
Place the marinated chicken on a baking tray or grill. Cook for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway.

Step 6:
Baste the chicken with 1 tbsp butter and grill for another 5 minutes until slightly charred.

Step 7:
(Optional) For a smoky flavor, place a hot charcoal piece in a small bowl inside the chicken dish, pour a little butter or oil over it, cover, and let it sit for 5 minutes.

Step 8:
Garnish with onion rings, lemon wedges, and fresh coriander leaves.

Step 9:
Serve hot with mint chutney and naan.

column2: Chickpea flour, methi leaves, jowar flour, wheat flour
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 2 cups whole wheat flour, 1/4 cup gram flour (besan), 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp ginger-green chili paste, 2 tbsp curd, 2 tbsp oil, salt, and 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves.

Step 2:
Add water gradually and knead into a soft dough. Rest for 20 mins.

Step 3:
Divide the dough into small balls and roll each into thin round rotis.

Step 4:
Heat a tawa, cook theplas on both sides with little oil until golden brown.

Step 5:
Serve hot with curd, pickle, or masala tea.

column2: Sweet potato, surti papdi, baby potatoes, valor papdi, green peas
column5:
Step 1: Mix besan, methi leaves, red chili powder, and salt, knead into a soft dough, make small balls, and deep fry to make muthiya.
Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add cumin seeds and sauté.
Step 3: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt.
Step 4: Add all vegetables and cook covered for 15 mins on low flame.
Step 5: Add muthiya and garam masala, cook for 5 mins.
Step 6: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and lemon juice.

column2: Chana dal, urad dal, ginger, curry leaves, sugar
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, and few curry leaves. Let them splutter.

Step 2:
Add 1 chopped onion, 1-2 green chilies (chopped), and 1 tsp ginger (grated). Sauté until onions turn soft.

Step 3:
Add 1/2 cup chopped vegetables (carrot, peas) and sauté for 2-3 mins.

Step 4:
Add 1 cup semolina (rava) and roast on low flame for 3-4 mins until light golden.

Step 5:
Pour 2.5 cups hot water, salt, and stir continuously to avoid lumps.

Step 6:
Cover and cook for 3-4 mins on low flame. Add lemon juice and coriander leaves.

column2: Chana dal, urad dal, thick poha, tomato, butter
column5:
Step 1:
Prepare batter by soaking 1 cup rice, 1/4 cup urad dal, and 1 tbsp fenugreek seeds for 6 hours. Grind into a smooth batter, add salt, and ferment overnight for 8-10 hours.

Step 2:
Chop 1 onion, 1 tomato, 1 green chili, 1 small capsicum, and few coriander leaves.

Step 3:
Heat a tawa, pour a ladle of batter, and spread thick like a pancake.

Step 4:
Sprinkle chopped onions, tomatoes, chilies, and capsicum on top. Drizzle a little oil around the edges.

Step 5:
Cook on low flame until golden at the bottom. Flip and cook the other side for 1-2 mins.

Step 6:
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

column2: Urad dal, ginger, curry leaves, green chilies, black pepper
column5:
Step 1:
Soak 1 cup urad dal in water for 4-5 hours. Drain and grind into a smooth batter with little water.

Step 2:
Add 1 chopped onion, 2 chopped green chilies, 1 tsp ginger (grated), few curry leaves (chopped), 2 tbsp coriander leaves, and salt. Mix well.

Step 3:
Wet your hands, take a small portion of batter, shape into a round, and make a hole in the center.

Step 4:
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry vadas on medium flame until golden and crispy.

Step 5:
Drain on tissue paper.

Step 6:
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

column2: coconut, milk or cream, sugar, and cardamom
column5:
Step 1:
In a pan, heat 1 tsp ghee and add 2 cups grated coconut. Roast on low flame for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.

Step 2:
Add 1 cup condensed milk and mix well. Cook on low flame until the mixture thickens.

Step 3:
Add ½ tsp cardamom powder and 2 tbsp chopped dry fruits like almonds and cashews. Mix well.

Step 4:
Turn off the flame and let the mixture cool slightly.

Step 5:
Grease your hands with ghee and shape the mixture into small round laddus.

Step 6:
Roll the laddus in grated coconut for a perfect coating.

Step 7:
Let them set for 30 minutes at room temperature.

Step 8:
Serve or store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

column2: All-purpose flour (Maida), Powdered sugar, Baking powder, Salt, Milk, Oil, Vanilla essence, Dark chocolate, Butter
column5:
Step 1:
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease the ramekins with butter or oil.

Step 2:
Melt 100g dark chocolate and 50g butter using a double boiler or microwave. Stir until smooth and set aside.

Step 3:
In a bowl, mix ½ cup all-purpose flour (maida), ¼ cup powdered sugar, ¼ tsp baking powder, and a pinch of salt.

Step 4:
Add ¼ cup milk, 2 tbsp oil, and ½ tsp vanilla essence to the dry ingredients. Mix well.

Step 5:
Pour the melted chocolate mixture into the batter and combine gently.

Step 6:
Grease the ramekins and fill them ¾ full with the batter.

Step 7:
Bake for 12-15 minutes until the edges are set but the center remains gooey.

Step 8:
Let them cool for 2 minutes, then invert onto a plate.

Step 9:
Serve hot with ice cream or chocolate syrup.

column2: All-purpose flour, Sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Milk, Oil, Vanilla essence, Strawberry puree, Fresh strawberries, Whipping cream
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease the cake tin with butter or oil.

Step 2: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, baking powder, and baking soda.

Step 3: Whisk sugar, oil, and vanilla essence until creamy.

Step 4: Add strawberry puree to the mixture and combine well.

Step 5: Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture along with milk, stirring until smooth.

Step 6: Pour the batter into the greased tin and bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Step 7: Let the cake cool completely.

Step 8: Decorate with whipping cream and fresh strawberries before serving.

column2: Banana, All-purpose flour, Sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Salt, Oil, Vanilla essence, Milk.
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease the cake tin with 1 tbsp butter or oil.

Step 2: In a bowl, mash 2 ripe bananas until smooth and add ½ cup sugar, ¼ cup oil, and 1 tsp vanilla essence. Mix well.

Step 3: Sift 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and ½ tsp baking soda into the mixture and combine.

Step 4: Gradually pour in ¼ cup milk and stir until the batter becomes smooth.

Step 5: Add ¼ cup chopped walnuts (optional) and fold gently into the batter.

Step 6: Pour the batter into the greased tin and bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

Step 7: Let the cake cool completely before slicing and serving.

column2: All-purpose flour, Sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Salt, Milk, Oil, Vanilla essence, Vinegar (optional for eggless), Butter (optional), Whipping cream (for frosting).
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease the cake tin with 1 tbsp butter or oil.

Step 2: In a bowl, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and ½ tsp baking soda.

Step 3: In another bowl, whisk ½ cup sugar, ¼ cup oil, and 1 tsp vanilla essence until creamy.

Step 4: Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture while pouring ½ cup milk slowly and stir to form a smooth batter.

Step 5: Pour the batter into the greased tin and tap to remove air bubbles.

Step 6: Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

Step 7: Let the cake cool completely before decorating with whipping cream or serving.

column2: All-purpose flour, Peanut butter, Sugar, Brown sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Butter, Vanilla essence, Milk, Salt.
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.

Step 2: In a bowl, whisk ½ cup peanut butter, ¼ cup butter (softened), ½ cup sugar, and ¼ cup brown sugar until creamy.

Step 3: Add 1 tsp vanilla essence and mix well.

Step 4: Sift 1 cup all-purpose flour, ½ tsp baking powder, and ¼ tsp baking soda into the mixture.

Step 5: Gradually add 2 tbsp milk to form a soft dough.

Step 6: Shape the dough into small balls, place them on the tray, and flatten slightly with a fork.

Step 7: Bake for 12-15 minutes until the edges turn golden.

Step 8: Let the cookies cool completely before serving.

column2: Milk, Sugar, Cornflour, Vanilla essence, Cocoa powder, Condensed milk, Custard powder (optional), Dry fruits, Chocolate syrup (optional).
column5:
Step 1: In a saucepan, heat 2 cups milk on medium flame.

Step 2: Add ½ cup sugar and stir until dissolved.

Step 3: In a small bowl, mix 2 tbsp cornflour with ¼ cup cold milk to form a smooth paste.

Step 4: Slowly pour the cornflour mixture into the hot milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.

Step 5: Add 1 tsp vanilla essence and cook until the mixture thickens.

Step 6: Pour the pudding into serving bowls and let it cool.

Step 7: Refrigerate for 2-3 hours to set.

Step 8: Garnish with dry fruits or chocolate syrup before serving.

column2: Milk, Sugar, Cocoa powder, Fresh cream, Condensed milk, Vanilla essence, Dark chocolate (optional), Chocolate chips (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
Melt 100g dark chocolate in a microwave or double boiler. Add 1/2 cup cocoa powder and mix well. Let it cool at room temperature.

Step 2:
In a bowl, whisk 2 cups heavy cream using an electric beater until soft peaks form.

Step 3:
Add 1 cup condensed milk, 1 tsp vanilla essence, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, and the melted chocolate mixture into the whipped cream. Fold gently using a spatula without overmixing.

Step 4:
Pour the mixture into an airtight container. Cover with cling wrap and freeze for 6-8 hours until set.

Step 5:
Scoop out the creamy ice cream and garnish with choco chips or chocolate syrup before serving.

column2: Milk, Sugar, Fresh cream, Condensed milk, Vanilla essence, Cornflour (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, whisk 2 cups heavy cream using an electric beater until soft peaks form.

Step 2:
Add 1 cup condensed milk, 1 tsp vanilla essence, and 1/2 cup powdered sugar into the whipped cream.

Step 3:
Gently fold the mixture using a spatula until everything is combined.

Step 4:
Pour the mixture into an airtight container. Cover with cling wrap and freeze for 6-8 hours or until set.

Step 5:
Scoop out the creamy vanilla ice cream and serve with chocolate syrup, sprinkles, or fresh fruits.

column2: All-purpose flour, Sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Milk, Oil, Vanilla essence, Pineapple slices, Pineapple syrup, Whipping cream, Chopped pineapple (for garnish).
column5:
Step 1:
Preheat the oven to 180°C and grease a baking tin with butter or oil.

Step 2:
In a bowl, whisk 1 cup powdered sugar and 1/2 cup oil or butter until creamy.

Step 3:
Add 1 cup curd (yogurt) and 1 tsp vanilla essence, then mix well.

Step 4:
Sift in 1½ cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and ½ tsp baking soda.

Step 5:
Add 1/2 cup pineapple juice and mix gently until the batter is smooth.

Step 6:
Pour the batter into the greased tin, garnish with pineapple slices on top, and bake for 30-35 minutes or until golden brown.

Step 7:
Cool completely, decorate with whipped cream or pineapple chunks, and serve!

column2: All-purpose flour, Sugar, Brown sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Butter, Vanilla essence, Milk, Chocolate chips, Salt.
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, whisk 1/2 cup butter (softened) and 1/2 cup powdered sugar until creamy.

Step 2:
Add 1/4 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla essence, and 1 egg. Mix until smooth.

Step 3:
Sift in 1½ cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 tsp baking soda, and a pinch of salt.

Step 4:
Add 1 cup chocolate chips and mix gently to form a soft dough.

Step 5:
Scoop small portions of dough onto a baking tray lined with parchment paper.

Step 6:
Bake at 180°C for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.

Step 7:
Cool completely, serve with milk, and enjoy your delicious cookies!

column2: All-purpose flour, Sugar, Cocoa powder, Baking powder, Baking soda, Milk, Oil, Vanilla essence, Whipping cream, Cherries, Chocolate shavings, Sugar syrup.
column5:
Step 1:
Preheat the oven to 180°C and grease two cake tins.

Step 2:
In a bowl, whisk 1 cup powdered sugar and 1/2 cup oil or butter until creamy.

Step 3:
Add 1 cup curd (yogurt), 1 tsp vanilla essence, and mix well.

Step 4:
Sift in 1½ cups all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1/2 tsp baking soda. Mix gently.

Step 5:
Add 1/2 cup milk gradually and fold the batter until smooth.

Step 6:
Pour into the greased tins and bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Let the cakes cool completely.

Step 7:
Cut the cakes into two layers each. Brush each layer with cherry syrup or sugar syrup.

Step 8:
Whip 2 cups heavy cream with 2 tbsp powdered sugar until stiff peaks form.

Step 9:
Spread whipped cream on each layer and add chopped cherries between layers.

Step 10:
Cover the whole cake with whipped cream, decorate with chocolate shavings, cherries, and chocolate syrup.

Step 11:
Chill the cake for 1-2 hours before serving.

column2: All-purpose flour, Sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Butter, Milk, Vanilla essence, Mixed dry fruits (raisins, almonds, cashews), Tutti frutti, Orange juice, Cinnamon powder (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
Preheat the oven to 180°C and grease a cake tin with butter or oil.

Step 2:
In a bowl, whisk 1/2 cup butter and 3/4 cup powdered sugar until creamy.

Step 3:
Add 1 cup curd (yogurt) and 1 tsp vanilla essence, then mix well.

Step 4:
Sift in 1½ cups all-purpose flour, 1 tsp baking powder, and 1/2 tsp baking soda.

Step 5:
Add 1/4 cup milk and fold the batter gently.

Step 6:
Mix 1 cup chopped dry fruits (raisins, almonds, cashews, cherries) with 1 tbsp flour and add to the batter.

Step 7:
Pour the batter into the greased tin and bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Step 8:
Cool completely, slice, and serve your delicious fruit cake!

column2: All-purpose flour, Cocoa powder, Sugar, Baking powder, Baking soda, Butter, Milk, Vanilla essence, Dark chocolate, Ice cream (vanilla), Chocolate syrup.
column5:
Step 1:
Preheat the oven to 180°C and grease a baking tray with butter.

Step 2:
Melt 100g dark chocolate and 1/2 cup butter in a bowl using a double boiler or microwave.

Step 3:
Add 1 cup powdered sugar and mix well.

Step 4:
Add 1/2 cup milk and 1 tsp vanilla essence, then mix again.

Step 5:
Sift in 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/4 cup cocoa powder, 1/2 tsp baking powder, and a pinch of salt.

Step 6:
Fold everything gently to form a smooth batter. Pour into the baking tray and bake for 20-25 minutes.

Step 7:
Once baked, cut into squares and place one brownie piece on a hot sizzling plate.

Step 8:
Top with vanilla ice cream and drizzle hot chocolate sauce over it.

Step 9:
Serve immediately and enjoy the sizzling sound with each bite!

column2: Chicken, curd, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, garam masala, coriander powder, salt, oil, capsicum, onion, butter, chaat masala.
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, mix 500g boneless chicken (cubes), 1/2 cup curd, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp coriander powder, salt, and 2 tbsp oil.

Step 2:
Marinate for 2-3 hours (or overnight for better flavor).

Step 3:
Thread marinated chicken onto skewers with capsicum and onion pieces (optional).

Step 4:
Grill in oven at 200°C for 15-20 mins or shallow fry in a pan until golden and cooked.

Step 5:
Brush with butter and sprinkle with chaat masala.

Step 6:
Serve hot with green chutney and lemon wedges.

column2: Fish, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, salt, rice flour, gram flour, oil, curry leaves.
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 500g fish fillets with 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, salt, and 1 tbsp oil. Rest for 30 mins.

Step 2:
Coat the marinated fish in rice flour or gram flour for crispiness.

Step 3:
Heat oil in a pan and shallow fry fish on medium flame until golden and crispy on both sides.

Step 4:
Drain excess oil on tissue paper.

Step 5:
Serve hot with lemon wedges and mint chutney.

column2: Egg, wheat flour, onion, green chili, capsicum, tomato, ginger-garlic paste, black pepper powder, red chili powder, salt, lemon juice, oil, tomato ketchup, green chutney.
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, knead 1 cup wheat flour, 1/4 tsp salt, and water into a soft dough. Rest for 15 mins.

Step 2:
Whisk 2 eggs with salt, black pepper powder, and chopped coriander leaves.

Step 3:
Roll dough into thin rotis and cook on a tawa with little oil.

Step 4:
Pour whisked egg over the roti and cook until the egg sets. Flip and cook the other side.

Step 5:
Place on a plate, add sliced onion, cucumber, green chutney, tomato ketchup, and lemon juice.

Step 6:
Roll tightly and serve hot.

column2: Prawns, curd, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, garam masala, coriander powder, salt, mustard oil, kasuri methi, chaat masala.
column5:
Step 1:
Clean 500g prawns and marinate with 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, salt, and 1/2 tsp turmeric powder for 15 mins.

Step 2:
In another bowl, mix 1/2 cup curd, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp kasuri methi, 1 tbsp mustard oil, and salt.

Step 3:
Add marinated prawns to the curd mixture and coat well. Rest for 30 mins.

Step 4:
Grill prawns in an oven at 200°C for 10-12 mins or shallow fry on a pan until cooked and golden.

Step 5:
Brush with butter and sprinkle with chaat masala.

Step 6:
Serve hot with mint chutney and lemon wedges.

column2: Eggs, onion, tomato, green chili, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, salt, oil, coriander leaves.
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil or butter in a pan. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and let them splutter.

Step 2:
Add 1 chopped onion, 1-2 chopped green chilies, and 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste. Sauté until onions turn golden.

Step 3:
Add 1 chopped tomato, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, and salt. Cook until tomatoes turn soft.

Step 4:
Break 3-4 eggs directly into the pan and scramble them. Stir continuously on medium flame.

Step 5:
Cook for 2-3 minutes until eggs are soft and fluffy.

Step 6:
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with roti, pav, or bread.

column2: Chicken, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, black pepper powder, salt, cornflour, all-purpose flour, egg, breadcrumbs, oil.
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 500g chicken pieces with 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp black pepper powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, and salt. Rest for 1 hour.

Step 2:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cornflour, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, salt, and black pepper powder.

Step 3:
Dip marinated chicken in beaten egg, then coat with the flour mixture.

Step 4:
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry chicken on medium flame until golden and crispy.

Step 5:
Drain on tissue paper.

Step 6:
Serve hot with ketchup or mayonnaise.

column2: Eggs, boiled potatoes, onion, green chili, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, coriander leaves, breadcrumbs, egg (for coating), oil.
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 4 eggs and 2 potatoes. Peel and mash the potatoes.

Step 2:
Chop 1 onion, 1 green chili, and coriander leaves.

Step 3:
Mix mashed potatoes with chopped onion, green chili, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt, and coriander leaves.

Step 4:
Slice boiled eggs into halves or quarters.

Step 5:
Take a portion of potato mixture, flatten it, place egg slice inside, and cover it completely into a cutlet shape.

Step 6:
Dip cutlets in beaten egg, coat with breadcrumbs, and shallow fry until golden and crispy.

Step 7:
Serve hot with ketchup or mint chutney.

column2: Prawns, garlic, butter, lemon juice, black pepper powder, red chili flakes, salt, parsley, oil.
column5:
Step 1:
Clean 500g prawns and marinate with 1 tbsp lemon juice, salt, and black pepper powder for 15 mins.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp butter and 1 tbsp oil in a pan. Add 6-7 finely chopped garlic cloves and sauté until golden.

Step 3:
Add 1 tsp red chili flakes and prawns. Cook for 3-4 mins until prawns turn pink.

Step 4:
Add 1 tbsp lemon juice, salt, and black pepper powder. Toss well.

Step 5:
Garnish with chopped parsley or coriander leaves.

Step 6:
Serve hot with garlic bread or as a starter.

column2: Chicken, boiled potatoes, onion, green chili, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, coriander leaves, breadcrumbs, egg (for coating), oil.
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 250g minced chicken with salt, ginger-garlic paste, and black pepper powder until cooked. Let it cool.

Step 2:
In a bowl, mix cooked chicken with 1 boiled mashed potato, 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped green chili, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt, and chopped coriander leaves.

Step 3:
Shape the mixture into small round patties.

Step 4:
Dip each patty in beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.

Step 5:
Shallow fry in oil until golden and crispy.

Step 6:
Serve hot with ketchup or green chutney.

column2: Fish, boiled potatoes, onion, green chili, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, coriander leaves, breadcrumbs, egg (for coating), oil.
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 250g fish fillets with salt, turmeric powder, and ginger-garlic paste. Let it cool, then shred the fish.

Step 2:
In a bowl, mix shredded fish with 1 boiled mashed potato, 1 chopped onion, 1 chopped green chili, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, salt, and chopped coriander leaves.

Step 3:
Shape into small cutlets or round patties.

Step 4:
Dip each cutlet in beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.

Step 5:
Shallow fry in oil until golden and crispy.

Step 6:
Serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

column2: Chicken, curd, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, salt, cumin powder, coriander powder, egg, breadcrumbs, mustard oil, kasuri methi, chaat masala.
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 500g chicken boneless pieces with 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, salt, and 1/2 tsp turmeric powder for 30 mins.

Step 2:
In another bowl, mix 1/2 cup curd, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp cumin powder, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp kasuri methi, 1 tbsp mustard oil, and salt. Add marinated chicken and coat well. Rest for 1 hour.

Step 3:
Coat marinated chicken in beaten egg and breadcrumbs.

Step 4:
Grill chicken in oven at 200°C for 15-20 mins or shallow fry until golden and cooked.

Step 5:
Brush with butter and sprinkle with chaat masala.

Step 6:
Serve hot with mint chutney and onion salad.

column2: Chicken, ginger-garlic paste, soy sauce, red chili sauce, green chili, onion, capsicum, vinegar, cornflour, all-purpose flour, black pepper powder, salt, spring onion, oil.
column5:
Step 1:
In a bowl, marinate 300g boneless chicken pieces with 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, salt, and black pepper powder for 30 mins.

Step 2:
Coat chicken with 2 tbsp cornflour and 2 tbsp all-purpose flour. Deep fry until golden and crispy.

Step 3:
Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, sauté 1 chopped onion, 2-3 chopped garlic cloves, and 1 chopped green chili until golden.

Step 4:
Add 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp red chili sauce, 1 tbsp tomato ketchup, 1 tsp vinegar, and salt. Cook for 2 mins.

Step 5:
Dissolve 1 tsp cornflour in 1/2 cup water and pour into the pan. Cook until sauce thickens.

Step 6:
