Add fried chicken and toss well. Garnish with spring onions.

Step 7:
Serve hot with fried rice or noodles.

column2: Chicken, buttermilk, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, black pepper powder, salt, all-purpose flour, cornflour, paprika, garlic powder, egg, breadcrumbs, oil.
column5:
Step 1:
Marinate 500g chicken pieces with 2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp black pepper powder, and salt. Rest for 1 hour.

Step 2:
In a bowl, mix 1 cup all-purpose flour, 1/2 cup cornflour, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1/2 tsp black pepper powder, and salt.

Step 3:
Dip marinated chicken in beaten egg, then coat with the flour mixture. Repeat the process for extra crispiness.

Step 4:
Heat oil in a pan and deep fry chicken on medium flame until golden and crispy.

Step 5:
Drain excess oil on tissue paper.

Step 6:
Serve hot with ketchup, mayonnaise, or spicy dip.

column2: Toor dal, water, tamarind, mustard seeds, dried red chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida, turmeric powder, salt, oil, chopped vegetables (carrot, beans, brinjal, drumstick), sambhar powder, coriander leaves, cooked rice.
column5:
Step 1: Wash 1 cup toor dal and pressure cook with 3 cups water, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, and salt for 3-4 whistles until soft. Mash the dal once cooked.

Step 2: Soak a small lemon-sized ball of tamarind in warm water for 10 minutes. Squeeze and extract the juice.

Step 3: In a pan, add 1/2 cup carrot, 1/2 cup beans, 1/2 cup brinjal, 2 pieces drumstick, tamarind water, salt, and turmeric powder. Cook until vegetables become soft.

Step 4: Add mashed dal to the vegetables. Add 2 tbsp sambhar powder and cook for 10-15 minutes on medium flame.

Step 5: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a small pan, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 2 dried red chilies, 8-10 curry leaves, and 1/4 tsp asafoetida. Pour this tempering over the sambhar.

Step 6: Garnish with 2 tbsp chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with 2 cups cooked rice.

column2: Cooked rice, oil, garlic, onion, carrot, capsicum, beans, green peas, soy sauce, vinegar, black pepper powder, salt, spring onions.
column5:
Step 1: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 4 chopped garlic cloves and sauté for 30 seconds.

Step 2: Add 1 chopped onion and sauté until translucent.

Step 3: Add 1/2 cup carrot, 1/2 cup capsicum, 1/2 cup beans, and 1/4 cup green peas. Stir-fry on high flame for 3-4 minutes.

Step 4: Add 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tsp vinegar, 1 tsp black pepper powder, and salt as per taste. Mix well.

Step 5: Add 2 cups cooked rice and toss everything on high flame for 2-3 minutes.

Step 6: Garnish with 2 tbsp chopped spring onions and serve hot.

column2: Curd, oil, mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dried red chilies, garlic, green chilies, curry leaves, asafoetida, turmeric powder, salt, coriander leaves.
column5:
Step 1: Whisk 2 cups curd in a bowl until smooth and add salt as per taste.

Step 2: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tsp mustard seeds and 1 tsp cumin seeds. Let them splutter.

Step 3: Add 2 dried red chilies, 4 chopped garlic cloves, 1 chopped green chili, and 8-10 curry leaves. Sauté for a few seconds.

Step 4: Add 1/4 tsp asafoetida and 1/2 tsp turmeric powder. Mix well.

Step 5: Pour the hot tempering over the whisked curd and mix gently.

Step 6: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve chilled with roti or rice.

column2: Chicken wings, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, baking powder, olive oil, butter, hot sauce, honey, soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, cornstarch, sesame seeds, green onions.
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C) or set the air fryer to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: Pat the chicken wings dry with paper towels to remove moisture.

Step 3: In a bowl, mix salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, and baking powder.

Step 4: Toss the wings in the seasoning mixture until evenly coated.

Step 5: Place the wings on a wire rack over a baking sheet (for oven) or in the air fryer basket.

Step 6:

Oven: Bake for 40-45 minutes, flipping halfway.
Air Fryer: Cook for 20-25 minutes, shaking the basket halfway.
Step 7: In a saucepan, melt butter and add hot sauce, honey, soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Simmer for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.

Step 8: Toss the crispy wings in the sauce until fully coated.

Step 9: Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions if desired.

Step 10: Serve hot and enjoy!

column2: Fish fillets (cod, tilapia, or haddock), salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, lemon juice, all-purpose flour, eggs, breadcrumbs (panko or regular), Parmesan cheese (optional), dried oregano, dried thyme, vegetable oil, tartar sauce.
column5:
Step 1: Cut the fish fillets into thin strips, about 1-inch wide.

Step 2: Pat the fish dry with paper towels and season with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, paprika, and lemon juice. Let it rest for 10 minutes.

Step 3: Prepare three bowls:

Bowl 1: Add flour.
Bowl 2: Beat eggs.
Bowl 3: Mix breadcrumbs, Parmesan cheese, oregano, and thyme.
Step 4: Coat each fish strip by dipping it first in flour, then in egg, and finally in breadcrumb mixture, pressing gently so the coating sticks.

Step 5: Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat.

Step 6: Fry the fish fingers in batches for 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown and crispy.

Step 7: Remove and place on a paper towel to drain excess oil.

Step 8: Serve hot with tartar sauce or your favorite dip. Enjoy!

column2: All-purpose flour, warm water, yeast, sugar, salt, olive oil, tomatoes (pureed), garlic (minced), oregano, basil, chili flakes, black pepper, tomato ketchup (optional), mozzarella cheese, bell peppers, onions, black olives, sweet corn, mushrooms, jalapeños, cherry tomatoes, paneer or tofu (optional), oregano, chili flakes.
column5:
For the Dough
Step 1 Take 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon yeast, ½ cup warm water, 1 teaspoon sugar, ½ teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon olive oil

For the Toppings
Step 2 Take ½ cup pizza sauce, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, ½ cup sliced bell peppers (red, yellow, green), ½ cup sliced onions, ½ cup sliced mushrooms, ¼ cup sliced black olives, ¼ cup sweet corn, ½ teaspoon oregano, ½ teaspoon chili flakes, and ½ teaspoon mixed Italian herbs

Instructions
Step 3 Mix warm water, sugar, and yeast in a bowl and let it sit for 5 to 10 minutes until foamy. Add flour, salt, and olive oil, then knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rise for 1 hour

Step 4 Preheat the oven to 200°C or 400°F

Step 5 Roll out the dough into a round shape and place it on a pizza tray

Step 6 Spread pizza sauce evenly over the base. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese. Add bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, black olives, and sweet corn. Sprinkle oregano, chili flakes, and Italian herbs

Step 7 Bake in the preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until the cheese melts and turns golden

Step 8 Slice and serve hot

column2: All-purpose flour, warm water, yeast, sugar, salt, olive oil, mozzarella cheese, paneer (cubed), capsicum, onion, garlic, green chilies, soy sauce, red chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, black pepper, salt, chili flakes, oregano, basil, sweet corn (optional), black olives (optional).
column5:
For the Dough
Step 1 Take 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 teaspoon yeast, ½ cup warm water, 1 teaspoon sugar, ½ teaspoon salt, and 1 tablespoon olive oil

For the Chilli Paneer Topping
Step 2 Take 200 grams paneer (cubed), 1 tablespoon oil, 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste, ½ cup sliced onions, ½ cup sliced bell peppers (red, yellow, green), 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon red chili sauce, 1 tablespoon tomato ketchup, ½ teaspoon vinegar, ½ teaspoon black pepper, and salt to taste

For the Pizza
Step 3 Take ½ cup pizza sauce, 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, ½ teaspoon oregano, ½ teaspoon chili flakes, and ½ teaspoon mixed Italian herbs

Instructions
Step 4 Mix warm water, sugar, and yeast in a bowl and let it sit for 5 to 10 minutes until foamy. Add flour, salt, and olive oil, then knead into a soft dough. Cover and let it rise for 1 hour

Step 5 Heat oil in a pan, add ginger-garlic paste, and sauté for a few seconds. Add onions and bell peppers, then sauté for 2 minutes. Add paneer, soy sauce, chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, black pepper, and salt. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes and set aside

Step 6 Preheat the oven to 200°C or 400°F

Step 7 Roll out the dough into a round shape and place it on a pizza tray

Step 8 Spread pizza sauce evenly over the base. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese. Add the prepared chilli paneer mixture. Sprinkle oregano, chili flakes, and mixed Italian herbs

Step 9 Bake in the preheated oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until the cheese melts and turns golden

Step 10 Slice and serve hot

column2: Burger buns, potatoes (boiled and mashed), bread crumbs, all-purpose flour, water, salt, black pepper, red chili powder, garam masala, cumin powder, garlic, ginger, green chilies (optional), onion, capsicum ,carrot, cabbage, sweet corn, mayonnaise, cheese slices, lettuce, ketchup, mustard sauce (optional), oil
column5:
For the Veggie Patty
Step 1 Take 2 boiled and mashed potatoes, ¼ cup boiled peas, ¼ cup grated carrots, ¼ cup finely chopped beans, ¼ cup boiled sweet corn, ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon black pepper, ½ teaspoon red chili powder, ½ teaspoon garam masala, ½ teaspoon cumin powder, 1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste, 2 tablespoons breadcrumbs, 1 tablespoon cornflour, and oil for frying

For the Burger
Step 2 Take 2 burger buns, 2 cheese slices, 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 2 tablespoons ketchup, 4 lettuce leaves, 4 tomato slices, 4 onion slices, and 4 cucumber slices

Instructions
Step 3 In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, boiled peas, grated carrots, beans, corn, salt, black pepper, red chili powder, garam masala, cumin powder, ginger-garlic paste, breadcrumbs, and cornflour. Shape into round patties

Step 4 Heat oil in a pan and shallow-fry the patties until golden brown on both sides

Step 5 Slice the burger buns and toast them lightly on a pan with butter

Step 6 Spread mayonnaise and ketchup on the bun base, place a lettuce leaf, add a veggie patty, place a cheese slice, add tomato, onion, and cucumber slices, and cover with the top bun

Step 7 Serve hot with fries or a dip

column2: Beef patties, salt, pepper, butter, cheddar cheese, burger bun, lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion, ketchup, mustard, mayonnaise.
column5:
For the Burger Patties
Step 1 Take 200 grams ground beef or plant-based patty mix, ½ teaspoon salt, ½ teaspoon black pepper, and 1 teaspoon butter or oil for cooking

For Assembling the Burger
Step 2 Take 1 burger bun, 2 cheese slices (cheddar or American), 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1 tablespoon ketchup, 1 teaspoon mustard (optional), 2 lettuce leaves, 2 tomato slices, 2 onion slices, and 2 pickle slices (optional)

Instructions
Step 3 In a bowl, mix ground beef or plant-based mix with salt and black pepper. Shape into two equal-sized patties

Step 4 Heat a pan, add butter or oil, and cook the patties for 3 to 4 minutes on each side until golden brown

Step 5 Place a cheese slice on each patty while still hot, allowing it to melt

Step 6 Toast the burger bun lightly on a pan with butter

Step 7 Spread mayonnaise, ketchup, and mustard on the bun base, place a lettuce leaf, add one cheese-covered patty, place another cheese-covered patty on top, then add tomato, onion, and pickle slices

Step 8 Cover with the top bun and serve hot with fries and a dip

column2: Bread, butter, garlic, salt, parsley (optional).
column5:

Instructions
Step 2 In a bowl, mix softened butter, minced garlic, salt, and parsley

Step 3 Spread the garlic butter mixture evenly on the bread slices

Step 4 Preheat a pan or oven to 180°C (350°F)

Step 5 Toast the bread on a pan until golden brown or bake in the oven for 8 to 10 minutes until crispy

Step 6 Serve hot

column2: Bread, butter, garlic, cheese (mozzarella or cheddar), salt, parsley (optional).
column5:
Step 1: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).

Step 2: In a bowl, mix 4 tbsp softened butter, 3-4 minced garlic cloves, 1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley (or 1 tsp dried parsley), and ½ tsp chili flakes (optional).

Step 3: Cut 1 loaf of French bread or baguette in half lengthwise or into slices, as preferred.

Step 4: Spread the prepared garlic butter mixture evenly over the cut bread.

Step 5: Sprinkle 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese (and ¼ cup cheddar cheese, if using) evenly over the bread.

Step 6: Add ½ tsp oregano on top for extra flavor.

Step 7: Place the bread on a baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes, until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Step 8: For a crispier texture, broil for 2 minutes at high heat.

Step 9: Remove from the oven, slice, and serve hot with marinara sauce or enjoy as is!

column2: Bread, butter, cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or American), salt (optional).
column5:
Step 1: Take 2 slices of bread and spread 1 tbsp butter on one side of each slice.

Step 2: Flip the slices over and spread 1 tbsp mayonnaise (optional) on the other side for extra crispiness.

Step 3: Sprinkle ½ cup shredded cheese evenly over one slice of bread.

Step 4: Add ½ tsp chili flakes and ½ tsp oregano (optional) for extra flavor.

Step 5: Place the second slice of bread on top, with the buttered side facing outward.

Step 6: Heat a pan or grill over medium heat.

Step 7: Place the sandwich on the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, pressing gently with a spatula.

Step 8: Flip the sandwich and cook the other side for 2-3 minutes until golden brown and crispy.

Step 9: Remove from the pan, slice diagonally, and serve hot with ketchup or any dip of your choice!

column2: Bread, butter, sweet corn, cheese, mayonnaise, black pepper, salt, chili flakes (optional).
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 1 cup boiled sweet corn, ½ cup grated cheese, 2 tbsp mayonnaise, 2 tbsp chopped capsicum, ½ tsp black pepper, ½ tsp chili flakes, ½ tsp oregano, and salt to taste.

Step 2: Take 2 slices of bread and spread 1 tbsp butter on one side of each slice.

Step 3: Spread the corn mixture evenly on the unbuttered side of one slice.

Step 4: Place the second slice of bread on top, with the buttered side facing outward.

Step 5: Heat a pan or grill over medium heat.

Step 6: Place the sandwich on the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, pressing gently with a spatula.

Step 7: Flip the sandwich and cook for another 2-3 minutes until golden brown and crispy.

Step 8: Remove from the pan, slice diagonally, and serve hot with ketchup or a dip of your choice!

column2: Potatoes, oil, salt.
column5:
Step 1: Peel 3 large potatoes and cut them into thin strips.

Step 2: Soak the potato strips in 3 cups cold water for 30 minutes (this removes excess starch and makes them crispier).

Step 3: Drain the potatoes and pat them dry using a kitchen towel.

Step 4: Heat 2 cups oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat.

Step 5: Fry the potatoes in small batches for 3-4 minutes until they are soft but not golden. Remove and drain on paper towels.

Step 6: Let the fries rest for 5 minutes while increasing the oil temperature to high heat.

Step 7: Fry the potatoes again for 2-3 minutes until golden and crispy.

Step 8: Remove from the oil, drain excess oil, and sprinkle with ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp black pepper, ½ tsp chili flakes, and ½ tsp oregano (if using).

Step 9: Serve hot with ketchup, mayo, or cheese dip!

column2: Potatoes, peas, carrots, beans, corn, breadcrumbs, flour, salt, black pepper, red chili powder, garam masala, cumin powder, ginger-garlic paste, oil.
column5:
Step 1: In a mixing bowl, add 2 boiled & mashed potatoes, ½ cup boiled peas, ½ cup grated carrot, ¼ cup boiled sweet corn, and ¼ cup chopped capsicum.

Step 2: Add 1 green chili (finely chopped), ½ tsp ginger-garlic paste, ½ tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp black pepper, ½ tsp garam masala, ½ tsp chaat masala, and salt to taste. Mix well.

Step 3: Add ¼ cup breadcrumbs and 2 tbsp cornflour to bind the mixture. Mix until it forms a dough-like consistency.

Step 4: Divide the mixture into equal portions and shape them into round patties.

Step 5: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan over medium heat.

Step 6: Place the patties in the pan and shallow fry for 3-4 minutes on each side until golden brown and crispy.

Step 7: Remove and drain excess oil on a paper towel.

Step 8: Serve hot with ketchup, green chutney, or use them in burgers!

column2: Hakka noodles, oil, garlic, ginger, onion, capsicum, carrot, cabbage, soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, black pepper, salt, spring onions.
column5:
Step 1: Boil 4 cups water in a large pan, add 1 tbsp oil and 200g Hakka noodles. Cook until al dente (firm but cooked).

Step 2: Drain the noodles, rinse with cold water, and toss with 1 tsp oil to prevent sticking.

Step 3: Heat 2 tbsp oil in a pan or wok on high flame.

Step 4: Add 1 tbsp chopped garlic and 1 chopped green chili (if using). Sauté for 30 seconds.

Step 5: Add ½ cup sliced onions, stir-fry for 1 minute.

Step 6: Add ½ cup sliced capsicum, ½ cup shredded cabbage, and ½ cup julienned carrots. Stir-fry on high heat for 2-3 minutes until slightly crunchy.

Step 7: Add 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp vinegar, 1 tbsp chili sauce, ½ tsp black pepper, ½ tsp salt, and ½ tsp sugar. Mix well.

Step 8: Add the boiled noodles and toss everything together for 2 minutes on high flame.

Step 9: Garnish with 1 tbsp chopped spring onions and serve hot!

column2: Pasta, water, salt, oil, tomatoes, onion, garlic, olive oil, chili flakes, black pepper powder, dried oregano, dried basil, tomato ketchup, sugar, bell peppers, mushrooms, sweet corn, cheese, fresh basil leaves.
column5:
Step 1: Boil 2 cups of pasta in 4 cups of water with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp oil until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Step 2: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a pan, add 4-5 minced garlic cloves, and sauté until fragrant.

Step 3: Add 1 small chopped onion and sauté until translucent.

Step 4: Pour in the puree of 2 large tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes until the sauce thickens.

Step 5: Add ½ tsp chili flakes, ½ tsp black pepper powder, 1 tsp dried oregano, ½ tsp dried basil, 2 tbsp tomato ketchup, ½ tsp sugar, and salt to taste. Mix well.

Step 6: Add ¼ cup chopped bell peppers, mushrooms, or sweet corn (optional) and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 7: Add the boiled pasta and mix well, coating it with the sauce.

Step 8: Garnish with grated cheese and fresh basil leaves. Serve hot.

column2: Pasta, water, salt, oil, butter, garlic, all-purpose flour, milk, black pepper powder, chili flakes, oregano, dried basil, cheese, bell peppers, mushrooms, sweet corn, fresh cream (optional), fresh parsley (for garnish).
column5:
Step 1: Boil 2 cups of pasta in 4 cups of water with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp oil until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Step 2: Heat 1 tbsp butter in a pan, add 4-5 minced garlic cloves, and sauté until fragrant.

Step 3: Add 1 tbsp all-purpose flour and cook on low flame for 1-2 minutes until slightly golden.

Step 4: Gradually add 1 cup of milk while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.

Step 5: Add ½ tsp black pepper powder, ½ tsp chili flakes, ½ tsp oregano, ½ tsp dried basil, and salt to taste. Mix well.

Step 6: Add ¼ cup chopped bell peppers, mushrooms, or sweet corn (optional) and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 7: Add ¼ cup grated cheese and stir until the sauce becomes creamy.

Step 8: Add the boiled pasta and mix well, coating it with the sauce.

Step 9: Garnish with fresh parsley and more cheese (optional). Serve hot.

column2: Pasta, water, salt, oil, butter, garlic, onion, tomatoes, tomato puree, all-purpose flour, milk, black pepper powder, chili flakes, oregano, dried basil, cheese, bell peppers, mushrooms, sweet corn, fresh cream (optional), tomato ketchup, sugar, fresh parsley (for garnish).
column5:
Step 1: Boil 2 cups of pasta in 4 cups of water with 1 tsp salt and 1 tsp oil until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Step 2: Heat 1 tbsp butter in a pan, add 4-5 minced garlic cloves, and sauté until fragrant.

Step 3: Add 1 small chopped onion and sauté until translucent.

Step 4: Pour in the puree of 2 large tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes until the sauce thickens.

Step 5: Add ½ tsp chili flakes, ½ tsp black pepper powder, 1 tsp dried oregano, ½ tsp dried basil, 2 tbsp tomato ketchup, ½ tsp sugar, and salt to taste. Mix well.

Step 6: In another pan, heat 1 tbsp butter, add 1 tbsp all-purpose flour, and cook on low flame for 1-2 minutes until slightly golden.

Step 7: Gradually add 1 cup of milk while stirring continuously to avoid lumps.

Step 8: Add ¼ cup grated cheese and mix well until the sauce becomes creamy.

Step 9: Combine both the red and white sauces, mix well, and let it simmer for a minute.

Step 10: Add ¼ cup chopped bell peppers, mushrooms, or sweet corn (optional) and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 11: Add the boiled pasta and mix well, coating it with the sauce.

Step 12: Garnish with fresh parsley and more cheese (optional). Serve hot.

column2: Cabbage, carrot, capsicum, spring onion, garlic, ginger, green chili, all-purpose flour, corn flour, soy sauce, red chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, black pepper powder, salt, sugar, water, oil, sesame seeds (optional), coriander leaves (for garnish).
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 1 cup grated cabbage, ½ cup grated carrot, 2 tbsp finely chopped capsicum, 2 tbsp corn flour, 2 tbsp all-purpose flour, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp black pepper powder, and ½ tsp soy sauce.

Step 2: Shape the mixture into small balls and deep-fry them in hot oil until golden brown. Drain and set aside.

Step 3: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tbsp finely chopped garlic, 1 tsp finely chopped ginger, and 1 chopped green chili. Sauté for a few seconds.

Step 4: Add ¼ cup chopped spring onions and ¼ cup chopped capsicum. Stir-fry for a minute.

Step 5: Add 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp red chili sauce, 1 tbsp tomato ketchup, 1 tsp vinegar, ½ tsp black pepper powder, and ½ tsp salt. Mix well.

Step 6: In a small bowl, mix 1 tbsp corn flour with ½ cup water to make a slurry.

Step 7: Add the corn flour slurry to the pan and stir continuously until the gravy thickens.

Step 8: Add 1 cup water (adjust for desired consistency) and let it simmer for 2-3 minutes.

Step 9: Add the fried Manchurian balls and mix well. Let it cook for a minute.

Step 10: Garnish with chopped spring onions and sesame seeds (optional). Serve hot with fried rice or noodles.

column2: Paneer (or cheese cubes), capsicum, onion, garlic, ginger, green chilies, soy sauce, red chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, black pepper powder, salt, sugar, corn flour, all-purpose flour, water, oil, spring onions (for garnish), sesame seeds (optional).
column5:
Step 1: Cut 200g paneer (or cheese cubes) into medium-sized pieces.

Step 2: In a bowl, mix 2 tbsp corn flour, 2 tbsp all-purpose flour, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp black pepper powder, and little water to make a smooth batter.

Step 3: Dip the paneer cubes into the batter, coat well, and deep-fry or shallow-fry until golden brown. Drain and set aside.

Step 4: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tbsp finely chopped garlic, 1 tsp finely chopped ginger, and 2 chopped green chilies. Sauté for a few seconds.

Step 5: Add ½ cup chopped onions and ½ cup chopped capsicum. Stir-fry on high flame for 2 minutes.

Step 6: Add 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp red chili sauce, 1 tbsp tomato ketchup, 1 tsp vinegar, ½ tsp black pepper powder, and ½ tsp salt. Mix well.

Step 7: In a small bowl, mix 1 tbsp corn flour with ¼ cup water to make a slurry.

Step 8: Add the corn flour slurry to the pan and stir continuously until the sauce thickens.

Step 9: Add the fried paneer cubes and mix well, coating them evenly with the sauce.

Step 10: Garnish with chopped spring onions and sesame seeds (optional). Serve hot.

column2: Curd , boondi, water, salt, black salt, roasted cumin powder, red chili powder, chaat masala, coriander leaves, mint leaves.
column5:
Step 1: Take 1 cup curd (yogurt) in a bowl and whisk it until smooth.

Step 2: Add ¼ cup water or milk and mix well to get a slightly thin consistency.

Step 3: Add ½ cup boondi (plain or masala) and mix gently.

Step 4: Add ½ tsp salt, ¼ tsp black salt, ½ tsp roasted cumin powder, ¼ tsp red chili powder, and ½ tsp chaat masala. Mix well.

Step 5: Optionally, add ½ tsp sugar for a slightly sweet taste.

Step 6: Let the raita sit for 5-10 minutes so the boondi softens.

Step 7: Garnish with chopped coriander leaves, mint leaves (optional), and a sprinkle of roasted cumin powder.

Step 8: Serve chilled with biryani, pulao, or paratha.

column2: Cabbage, carrot, capsicum, spring onion, garlic, ginger, green chili, all-purpose flour, corn flour, soy sauce, red chili sauce, tomato ketchup, vinegar, black pepper powder, salt, sugar, water, oil, spring onions (for garnish), sesame seeds (optional).
column5:
Step 1: In a bowl, mix 1 cup grated cabbage, ½ cup grated carrot, ¼ cup finely chopped capsicum, 2 tbsp corn flour, 2 tbsp all-purpose flour, ½ tsp salt, ½ tsp black pepper powder, and ½ tsp soy sauce.

Step 2: Shape the mixture into small balls and deep-fry them in hot oil until golden brown. Drain and set aside.

Step 3: Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, add 1 tbsp finely chopped garlic, 1 tsp finely chopped ginger, and 2 chopped green chilies. Sauté for a few seconds.

Step 4: Add ¼ cup chopped onions and ¼ cup chopped capsicum. Stir-fry on high flame for 2 minutes.

Step 5: Add 1 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp red chili sauce, 1 tbsp tomato ketchup, 1 tsp vinegar, ½ tsp black pepper powder, and ½ tsp salt. Mix well.

Step 6: Add the fried Manchurian balls and toss them in the sauce, coating them well.

Step 7: Garnish with chopped spring onions and sesame seeds (optional).

Step 8: Serve hot as a starter or side dish.

column2: Mutton, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, green chilies, yogurt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, garam masala, cumin seeds, bay leaf, cinnamon, cloves, cardamom, black pepper, salt, oil, water, fresh coriander leaves
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tbsp oil or ghee in a pressure cooker or heavy-bottomed pan.

Step 2:
Add 1 bay leaf, 1-inch cinnamon stick, 3 cloves, 3 green cardamoms, and 1 tsp cumin seeds. Sauté for a few seconds until aromatic.

Step 3:
Add 2 finely chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.

Step 4:
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste and 2 slit green chilies. Sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.

Step 5:
Pour in 2 pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil starts separating from the masala.

Step 6:
Add ½ tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1½ tsp coriander powder, and salt to taste. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes.

Step 7:
Add 500g mutton and stir well to coat it with the masala. Cook for 5-7 minutes until it changes color.

Step 8:
Add ½ cup whisked yogurt, mix well, and cook for 5 minutes on low heat.

Step 9:
Pour in 1½ cups water, cover, and pressure cook for 5-6 whistles (or simmer for 45-50 minutes if cooking in a pot).

Step 10:
Once the mutton is tender, add 1 tsp garam masala, ½ tsp black pepper powder, 1 tbsp kasuri methi, and 1 tbsp fresh cream (optional). Mix well and simmer for 5 minutes.

In a mixing bowl add all-purpose flour salt carom seeds and oil. Mix well until the flour resembles breadcrumbs. Gradually add water and knead into a firm dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes

Step 2: Prepare the Filling

Add coriander powder garam masala red chili powder turmeric powder amchur and salt. Mix everything properly and cook for a few minutes. column5:
Step 1: Marinate the Fish
Clean and cut the fish into pieces.

In a bowl, mix the fish with 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tbsp red chili powder, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/2 cup yogurt, and salt. Let it marinate for 30 minutes to 1 hour.

Step 2: Prepare Rice
Wash 1 1/2 cups basmati rice and soak it for 20 minutes.

In a large pot, bring 2 1/2 cups of water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt and the whole spices (bay leaf, cardamom, cloves, and cinnamon stick).

Add the soaked rice and cook it until it’s 70-80% done (parboiled). Drain the excess water and set the rice aside.

Step 3: Cook the Fish
Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Add sliced onions and sauté them until golden brown. Remove half of the fried onions for garnishing.

Add the marinated fish to the pan and cook for 5-6 minutes on medium heat, turning the fish pieces carefully so they don't break.

Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and cook until the tomatoes soften.

Add coriander powder, garam masala, biryani masala, and a pinch of salt. Stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes.

Remove from heat.

Step 4: Layer the Biryani
In a large pot or pressure cooker, layer the cooked fish mixture at the bottom.

Top it with a layer of the parboiled rice.

Sprinkle mint leaves, coriander leaves, lemon juice, and the reserved fried onions over the rice.

Optionally, drizzle the saffron milk over the top for added flavor and color.

Step 5: Final Cooking
Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid. If using a pressure cooker, don’t use the weight. Cook on low heat (dum) for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is fully cooked and the flavors have melded.

If cooking in a pot, you can place a heavy pan under the pot and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes.

Step 6: Serve
Gently fluff the biryani with a fork. Serve hot with raita or salad.

Step 4: Add Fish and Coconut Milk
Gently add the fish pieces to the pan. Be careful not to break the fish.

Pour in the coconut milk (or water for a lighter curry) and bring to a simmer. Add tamarind paste or lemon juice to add a tangy flavor.

Skewer the marinated prawns if using wooden or metal skewers (optional, but helps with easy flipping).

Place the prawns on the grill and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until they turn pink and opaque.

Avoid overcooking, as prawns can become rubbery. They should have grill marks and a slightly crispy texture on the outside.

Step 4: Serve
Once done, remove the prawns from the grill and garnish with fresh parsley or coriander leaves.

Serve with lemon wedges for extra zest.

column2: Prawns (peeled and deveined), oil, curry leaves, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, salt, water, chopped coriander leaves.
column5:
Step 1: Prepare the Prawns
Clean, peel, and devein the prawns. Pat them dry with a paper towel.

Step 2: Sauté Aromatics
Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and bay leaf. Let them splutter.

Add chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.

Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté for 2 minutes until fragrant.

Step 3: Cook Tomatoes and Spices
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes soften and release oil.

Stir in turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the oil separates from the masala.

Step 4: Add Prawns
Add the prawns to the pan and mix well with the masala.

Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the prawns turn pink and are cooked through.

Step 5: Add Water and Garam Masala
Add about 1/2 cup of water to the pan to create a gravy (adjust the consistency to your liking).

Stir in garam masala and cook for an additional 2 minutes to blend the flavors.

Step 6: Garnish and Serve
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

Serve hot with steamed rice, roti, or paratha.

column2: Prawns (peeled and deveined), oil or ghee, chopped onions, chopped tomatoes, green chilies, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, kasuri methi (optional), salt, lemon juice, fresh coriander leaves.
column5:
Step 1: Prepare the Prawns
Clean, peel, and devein the prawns. Pat them dry with a paper towel.

Step 2: Cook the Aromatics
Heat oil in a tawa (or a large pan) over medium heat.

Add mustard seeds and cumin seeds. Let them splutter.

Add dried red chilies and curry leaves. Stir for a few seconds to release the aroma.

Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they become golden brown.

Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for another 2 minutes.

Step 3: Cook Tomatoes and Spices
Add chopped tomatoes and slit green chilies. Cook until the tomatoes soften and release their oil.

Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Stir well and cook for 2-3 minutes until the masala is well-blended.

Step 4: Add Prawns
Add the prawns to the pan and cook for 4-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the prawns turn pink and are cooked through.

Be careful not to overcook the prawns, as they can become rubbery.

Step 5: Add Garam Masala and Lemon Juice
Sprinkle garam masala over the prawns and stir to coat evenly.

Add lemon juice to enhance the tanginess and freshness.

Step 6: Garnish and Serve
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.

Serve the prawn tawa masala hot with naan, roti, or rice.

column2: Prawns (peeled and deveined), turmeric powder, red chili powder, black pepper powder, salt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, rice flour or corn flour (optional, for crispiness), curry leaves, oil for frying.
column5:
Step 1:
Clean and devein 250g prawns. Rinse well and pat dry.

Step 2:
In a bowl, marinate the prawns with:

1/2 tsp turmeric powder

1 tsp red chili powder

1/2 tsp black pepper powder

1 tsp ginger-garlic paste

Salt to taste

1 tsp lemon juice
(Optional: Add 1 tbsp rice flour or corn flour for crispiness)
Mix well and let it rest for 15–30 minutes.

Step 3:
Heat 2–3 tbsp oil in a pan. Add a few curry leaves (optional) for aroma.

Step 4:
Add the marinated prawns and spread them out. Cook on medium heat for 3–4 minutes on one side.

Step 5:
Flip and cook the other side for another 3–4 minutes, until golden and slightly crispy.

Step 6:
Garnish with chopped coriander or a squeeze of lemon juice. Serve hot.

column2: Bhindi (okra), oil, cumin seeds, asafoetida (hing), fennel seeds, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, amchur (dry mango powder), salt, besan (gram flour) – optional.
column5:
Step 1:
Wash and dry the bhindi (okra) thoroughly. Trim the ends and make a vertical slit in each without cutting all the way through.

Step 2:
In a bowl, mix together the following spices: 1 tsp coriander powder, 1 tsp cumin powder, ½ tsp turmeric powder, ½ tsp red chili powder, ½ tsp garam masala, 1 tsp amchur (dry mango powder), salt to taste, and optionally 1–2 tsp besan (gram flour) for extra texture.

Step 3:
Stuff each bhindi with the spice mixture carefully.

Step 4:
Heat 2–3 tbsp oil in a pan. Add ½ tsp cumin seeds, a pinch of asafoetida (hing), and ½ tsp fennel seeds. Let them splutter.

Step 5:
Place the stuffed bhindi in the pan in a single layer. Cook on low-medium heat.

Step 6:
Cover and cook, turning occasionally, until bhindi is tender and slightly crispy. This should take around 15–20 minutes.

Step 7:
Serve hot with roti, paratha, or dal-chawal.

column2: Sarson (mustard greens), spinach (palak), bathua (optional), green chilies, ginger, garlic, onion (optional), maize flour (makki ka atta), salt, ghee or butter, water.
column5:
Step 1:
Clean and wash 500g sarson (mustard greens), 250g spinach, and 250g bathua (optional). Roughly chop them.

Step 2:
In a large pot or pressure cooker, add the greens, 2–3 chopped green chilies, 1-inch ginger (chopped), and some water. Cook until soft (15–20 mins in pot or 2–3 whistles in cooker).

Step 3:
Cool the mixture slightly and blend it coarsely using a hand blender or mixer.

Step 4:
Add 2 tbsp makki ka atta (maize flour) to the saag and simmer on low heat for 20–25 minutes, stirring occasionally to avoid sticking.

Step 5:
In a separate pan, heat 2 tbsp ghee. Add 1 chopped onion (optional), 4–5 chopped garlic cloves, and a pinch of hing. Sauté until golden.

Step 6:
Add the tempering (tadka) to the saag. Mix well and simmer for a few more minutes.

Step 7:
Serve hot with makki di roti, topped with a dollop of white butter or ghee.

column2: Full cream milk, lemon juice or vinegar (to curdle milk), sugar, water, cardamom powder, saffron strands, chopped pistachios, chopped almonds, rose water (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
Boil 1 liter full cream milk. Once it comes to a boil, lower the heat and add 2–3 tbsp lemon juice or vinegar to curdle the milk. Stir gently until the whey separates.

Step 2:
Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth to get chenna (paneer). Rinse it under cold water to remove lemon flavor, then squeeze out excess water.

Step 3:
Knead the chenna for 8–10 minutes until smooth. Make small, smooth balls and flatten them slightly to form discs.

Step 4:
In a wide pan, boil 1 cup sugar in 4 cups water to make sugar syrup. Once boiling, add the chenna discs and cover. Cook for 15–20 minutes on medium heat. They will expand.

Step 5:
Meanwhile, boil 1 liter full cream milk in another pan. Simmer until it reduces slightly. Add ¼ cup sugar, a pinch of cardamom powder, saffron strands, and chopped pistachios and almonds.

Step 6:
Once the chenna discs are cooked, let them cool slightly. Gently squeeze out excess syrup and transfer them to the flavored milk.

Step 7:
Chill Rasmalai in the refrigerator for a few hours. Garnish with more nuts before serving.

column2: Karela (bitter gourds), mustard oil, onions, salt, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, fennel seeds, cumin seeds, garam masala, amchur powder (dry mango powder), green chilies, ginger, garlic.
column5:
Step 1:
Wash and peel 4–5 medium-sized karelas (bitter gourds). Make a slit along the side of each karela and remove the seeds. Apply salt to the inside and outside, then set aside for 30 minutes to reduce bitterness. Rinse and pat dry.

Step 2:
Heat 2 tbsp mustard oil in a pan. Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and 1 tsp fennel seeds. Let them splutter.

Step 3:
Add 2 finely chopped onions. Sauté until golden brown.

Step 4:
Add 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste and 1 chopped green chili. Cook for a minute.

Step 5:
Add 1 tsp turmeric powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1.5 tsp coriander powder, 1/2 tsp garam masala, and 1 tsp amchur powder. Mix well.

Step 6:
Cook the spices for 2–3 minutes on low heat. Let the stuffing cool slightly.

Step 7:
Stuff the mixture into the slit karelas. Use thread to tie if needed to keep the stuffing in.

Step 8:
Heat 2–3 tbsp mustard oil in a pan. Shallow fry the stuffed karelas on medium heat, turning occasionally, until they are golden and cooked through (about 15–20 minutes).

Step 9:
Remove thread if used. Serve hot with roti or paratha.

column2: Vermicelli (sevai), ghee, sugar, milk (optional), water, cardamom powder, chopped dry fruits (like almonds, cashews, pistachios), raisins, saffron strands (optional), rose water or kewra water (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee in a pan.

Step 2:
Add 1 cup sevai (vermicelli) and roast on low heat until golden brown. Stir continuously.

Step 3:
In the same pan, add 2 cups of water (or 1 cup water + 1 cup milk for richer taste). Let it come to a boil.

Step 4:
Lower the heat and cook until the sevai softens (about 5–7 minutes).

Step 5:
Add 1/2 to 3/4 cup sugar (adjust to taste) and stir well until dissolved.

Step 6:
Add 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder, 1 tablespoon chopped almonds, 1 tablespoon chopped cashews, 1 tablespoon raisins, and saffron strands (optional).

Step 7:
Cook for 3–4 more minutes until the sevai absorbs the flavors and thickens slightly.

Step 8:
Optional: Add a few drops of rose water or kewra water for aroma.

Step 9:
Turn off the heat. Serve warm or chilled as desired.

column2: Vermicelli (thin) , sugar, milk (optional), water, ghee, cardamom powder, chopped dry fruits (almonds, cashews, pistachios), rose water or kewra water (optional), saffron strands (optional).
column5:
Step 1:
Take 2–3 feniyan discs (thin vermicelli rounds). Crush lightly if preferred.

Step 2:
Heat 1–2 tablespoons ghee in a pan on low flame. Lightly roast the feniyan until golden and crisp. Set aside.

Step 3:
In another pan, boil 1 cup water (or use 1/2 cup water + 1/2 cup milk for a creamier version).

Step 4:
Add 1/2 cup sugar (adjust to taste) and stir until fully dissolved.

Step 5:
Add 1/4 teaspoon cardamom powder and a few saffron strands (optional) to the syrup.

Step 6:
Add the roasted feniyan into the syrup. Let them soak and cook for 2–3 minutes until soft and the syrup is mostly absorbed.

Step 7:
Garnish with chopped dry fruits (almonds, cashews, pistachios) and a few drops of rose water or kewra water (optional).

Step 8:
Serve warm or chilled, as you like.

column2: Mixed dried fruits, pineapple, apple, orange, Strawberry , Nuts, Butter, Brown sugar, All-purpose flour, Baking powder, Baking soda, Cinnamon powder, Nutmeg powder, Vanilla extract, Orange juice or milk, Honey (optional), Rum or fruit juice (optional), Salt
column5:
Step 1: Prepare the Fruits and Nuts
Soak the dried fruits: In a bowl, soak the mixed dried fruits (raisins, apricots, dates, cranberries, prunes, etc.) in rum or fruit juice for at least 2 hours (overnight for best results).

Cut fresh strawberries, pineapple, apple, and orange zest into small pieces. Chop the nuts (cashews, almonds, walnuts) into small bits.

Step 2: Prepare the Cake Batter
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a cake pan.

Cream the butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.

Add vanilla extract, and mix well.

In a separate bowl, sift together all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon powder, nutmeg powder, and a pinch of salt.
Gradually add the sifted dry ingredients to the butter mixture, alternating with orange juice or milk.

Gently fold in the soaked dried fruits, chopped strawberries, pineapple, apple, orange zest, strawberry,and chopped nuts into the batter.

column2: Crushed graham crackers or digestive biscuits, Melted butter, Sugar, Cream cheese, Powdered sugar, Vanilla extract, Crushed pineapple (drained), Whipped cream or heavy cream (whipped), Pineapple slices or chunks (for topping), Pineapple jelly glaze (optional)
column5:
Step 1: Mix crushed biscuits, melted butter, and sugar. Press into a pan and chill.

Step 2: Beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla. Fold in crushed pineapple and whipped cream.

Step 3: Pour over crust, smooth the top, and refrigerate for 4–6 hours.

Step 4: Top with pineapple slices and optional jelly glaze. Garnish with coconut if desired and serve chilled

column2: Sugar, butter, cream cheese, vanilla extract, sour cream, all-purpose flour, Strawberry, lemon juice, cornstarch, water
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C). Mix the graham cracker crumbs, granulated sugar, and melted butter in a bowl. Press the mixture into the bottom of a springform pan. Bake for 10 minutes, then set aside to cool.

Step 2: In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla extract, and mix until combined. Stir in the sour cream and flour (if using) until smooth.

Step 3: Pour the cheesecake filling over the cooled crust. Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until the center is just slightly jiggly. Turn off the oven, leave the door slightly open, and let the cheesecake cool for about 1 hour.

Step 4: Refrigerate the cheesecake for at least 4 hours or overnight to set.

Step 5: To make the strawberry topping, combine fresh strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat for about 5-7 minutes until the strawberries release their juices. If you want a thicker topping, add the cornstarch slurry and cook for another minute. Let the topping cool.

Step 6: Once the cheesecake is chilled, spoon the strawberry topping over the cheesecake. Slice and serve!

column2: Maida , granulated sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, unsalted butter (melted), large egg, vanilla extract, milk, nuts, chocolate chips
column5:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a muffin tray with muffin liners or grease the tray.

Step 2: In a large bowl, whisk together maida, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.

Step 3: In a separate bowl, whisk together melted butter, egg, vanilla extract, and milk.

Step 4: Create a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet ingredients. Stir gently until just combined (do not overmix).

Step 5: Fold in your add-ins like chocolate chips, fruit, or nuts.

Step 6: Fill each muffin cup about ¾ full with batter.

Step 7: Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

Step 8: Let the muffins cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer them to a wire rack to cool completely.

column2: Bread , Paneer , onion , tomato , capsicum, green chutney, butter (or mayonnaise), chaat masala, salt, black pepper, fresh coriander leaves (optional)
column5:
Step 1: Prepare your filling by mixing paneer, chopped onion, tomato, capsicum, a spoonful of green chutney, a pinch each of chaat masala, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. Add chopped coriander if you like.

Step 2: Lightly butter one side of each bread slice.

Step 3: Spread a thin layer of green chutney on the unbuttered side of two slices.

Step 4: Spoon the paneer mixture evenly onto the chutney-spread slices.

Step 5: Top with the remaining bread slices, buttered side up, to form sandwiches.

Step 6: Heat a griddle or skillet over medium heat. Place the sandwiches on it and grill for 2–3 minutes per side, pressing gently, until golden brown and crisp.

Step 7: Remove from the pan, let cool for a minute, then cut diagonally.

Step 8: Serve hot with ketchup or extra chutney on the side. Enjoy!
